commit_message:
Introduce live_migration_claim()

Add live_migration_claim() to the resource tracker. It returns a
MoveClaim object that, in subsequent patches, will be used during live
migrations to claim resources on the destination.

Implements blueprint numa-aware-live-migration
Change-Id: I3bafebe86991f457569efcd7b6f130c5a0080437

commit_message:
Add `additive_only` parameter to Batch Member call

If `additive_only` is set, don't do a complete delta -- skip delete and
only update and create members (making the call additive rather than a
full replacement). This will allow for adding members in batches without
wiping out existing members.

Change-Id: I5e47d64243667cfaa10430e12229099b508de40e

commit_message:
Improve SEV documentation and other minor tweaks

This is a follow-up to the previous SEV commit which enables booting
SEV guests (I659cb77f12a3), making some minor improvements based on
nits highlighted during review:

- Clarify in the hypervisor-kvm.rst documentation that the
  num_memory_encrypted_guests option is optional, by rewording and
  moving it to the list of optional steps.

- Make things a bit more concise and avoid duplication of information
  between the above page and the documentation for the option
  num_memory_encrypted_guests, instead relying on appropriate
  hyperlinking between them.

- Clarify that virtio-blk can be used for boot disks in newer kernels.

- Hyperlink to a page explaining vhost-user

- Remove an unneeded mocking of a LOG object.

- A few other grammar / spelling tweaks.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I75b7ec3a45cac25f6ebf77c6ed013de86c6ac947

commit_message:
Drop support for --sort_key and --sort_dir

These arguments were deprecated in the kilo release in favor of a
combined --sort argument. This drops support for the deprecated
arguments.

Change-Id: If8f8ac44cc81f553009a15ca67257e86cb925b6f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-31 18:29:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(3 comments)

Did you mean to use a Set rather than a List?'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-31 19:47:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I agree with Matt that a Set would be more appropriate. However, we're covered several different ways if it remains a list.
- The db function returns distinct values (I think?) so we won't actually put duplicates into the list anyway.
- The placement API tolerates duplicates (uses sets internally) so even if we sent them through it would be fine."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-07-31 19:51:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

If a set is the thing to use then let's use that. It would/could/should mean at least no duplication on the aggregate metadata IN query to the DB API right?"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-07-31 20:01:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> It would/could/should mean at least no duplication on the aggregate metadata IN query to the DB API right?

I think it's the other way up. The result of the db query is what feeds these objects. And as previously stated, the query should only be returning unique aggs anyway.

But in the future we might be forbidding other aggs for other reasons, so could have ended up with duplicates that way.

...which, as previously stated, would be tolerated fine by the Placement API.

But yeah, better to do it with sets throughout."}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2019-08-07 12:43:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 27302, 'date': '2019-08-07 12:49:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

 > metadata IN query to the DB API right?

commit_message:
Nova object changes for forbidden aggregates request filter

This patch modifies Nova objects that will allow Destination object to
store list of forbidden aggregates that placement should ignore in
'GET /allocation_candidates' API at microversion 1.32, including the
code to generate the placement querystring syntax from them.

Change-Id: Ic2bcee40b41c97170a8603b27b935113f0633de7
Implements: blueprint placement-req-filter-forbidden-aggregates

commit_message:
Fix keystone-credential-cleanup job with Python 3

Python 3 renamed ConfigParser module to configparser.
This patch fixes compatibility with Python 3 for the
keystone-credential-cleanup job.

Change-Id: I6e34ba995d7a02f94b12162f0e5f8f326dfa8108

commit_message:
Fix bulk port functioning with requested security groups

When bulk ports are created with a security group supplied, the
resulting port(s) should only have that security group assigned. But the
resulting ports are getting both the requested security group as well as
the tenant default security group assigned.  This fixes that condition.

In order to ensure that bulk port creation results in the proper
assignment of security groups, add some testing.

Change-Id: I65aca7cd14447cc988e4bc4ab62bc7b9279e7522
Fixes-Bug: #1842666

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-05-26 21:29:03.000000000', 'message': 'Reschedule instance only if image properties changed in rebuild_instance.

When NUMATopologyFilter is used and resources are scarse, rescheduling
instances is not always possible.  This patch simply compares the
same properties NUMATopologyFilter is using and trigger a reschedule
if the properties are different.

Change-Id: I49366fbafd87b8bb1e49f9479d2298edbe82154d
closes-bug: #1804502

commit_message:
Reschedule instance only if image properties changed.

When NUMATopologyFilter is used and resources are scarse, rescheduling
instances is not always possible.  This patch simply compares the
same properties NUMATopologyFilter is using and trigger a reschedule
if the properties are different.

Change-Id: I49366fbafd87b8bb1e49f9479d2298edbe82154d
closes-bug: #1804502

Hi! Thanks for your first contribution.

I think before jumping to coding a fix we should make sure the bug your reporting is a valid one. For instance, if rebuilding with a new image, it's entirely possible for it to be refused because the new image requires resources that the instance's host can't provide. The "No valid host" error is common and doesn't tell us much. Could you attach full logs from nova-scheduler, nova-compute (and nova-conductor, why not) to your bug report. Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2019-01-10 22:42:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Avoid raising StopIteration in a generator function

This is broken in Python 3.7 due to PEP479.

Change-Id: Ia62d369dbf493d078e35e6bd911368becbd0ceff

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-06 02:41:04.000000000', 'message': "Only log unexpected rndc errors

A common false positive when bind is failing
to create a zone is the output that the zone
already exists.

This is usually due to a misconfiguration,
and not because the rndc command is failing.

We still log the rndc output using debug,
and log it in cases we don't except it to fail.

Change-Id: If0f6dd84959f67f32394084ea66d54e210dad966
"}, {'created': '2019-09-06 03:10:59.000000000', 'message': 'Only log unexpected rndc errors

A common false positive when bind is failing
to create a zone is the output that the zone
already exists.

This is usually due to a misconfiguration,
and not because the rndc command is failing.

We still log the rndc output using debug,
and log it in cases where it only would
fail due to legit issues talking to bind.

Change-Id: If0f6dd84959f67f32394084ea66d54e210dad966
'}]
commit_message:
Only log unexpected rndc errors

A common false positive when bind is failing
to create a zone is the output that the zone
already exists.

This is usually due to a misconfiguration,
and not because the rndc command is failing.

We still log the rndc output using debug,
and log it in cases where it only would
fail due to legit issues talking to bind.

Change-Id: If0f6dd84959f67f32394084ea66d54e210dad966

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-04 06:31:42.000000000', 'message': 'subjectAltName using DNS for IPv6

According to [1], Subject Alternative Name can use:
The subject alternative name extension allows various literal values
to be included in the configuration file. These include
email (an email address) URI a uniform resource indicator,
DNS (a DNS domain name), RID (a registered ID: OBJECT IDENTIFIER),
IP (an IP address), dirName (a distinguished name) and otherName.

The IP address used in the IP options can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.

We can use DNS for IPv4 only, IPv6 only and dual stack.

[1] https://www.openssl.org/docs/man1.0.2/man5/x509v3_config.html

Partially implements: blueprint ipv6-control-plane

Change-Id: Ibad8f8c734984aeda8ddac1a5db39875bc242bbf
'}, {'created': '2019-09-04 07:34:04.000000000', 'message': 'use DNS on subjectAltName for IPv6

commit_message:
Add DNS to subjectAltName in Self-Signed Certificate

According to [1]:
IP address used in the IP options can be in either IPv4 or IPv6 format.
DNS can be used for IPv4 only, IPv6 only and dual stack.

Also should have FQDNs in subjectAltName per current[2].

[1] https://www.openssl.org/docs/man1.0.2/man5/x509v3_config.html
[2] https://support.google.com/chrome/a/answer/7391219

Partially-Implements: blueprint ipv6-control-plane

Change-Id: Ibad8f8c734984aeda8ddac1a5db39875bc242bbf

[{'created': '2016-11-03 11:31:36.000000000', 'message': 'TestVolumeBootPattern: Add run_validation before ssh to an instance

This scenario ssh to an instance without checking run_validation flag.
In case tempest.conf validation is false , ssh to an instance should
be prevented.

In case run validation is enabled, we can check if its fix or
floating mode to ssh .

commit_message:
TestVolumeBootPattern: Add network flag

This scenario ssh to an instance using network.

Change-Id: I1f580d79f3944e74005b5923d42d0a1a3356b32c

According to the report, that seems to happen in midonet CI.
Why don't you set False as the existing port_security on the CI?"}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2016-11-03 04:11:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

i'm confused.  can you explain what's the intention of the option?

commit_message:
Don't ignore api_extensions for port security

CONF.network_feature_enabled.port_security [1] [2] was introduced
recently.  It's enabled by devstack unconditionally and breaks
plugins without the extension.  This commit fixes the regression
by avoiding using the extension unless it's available.

Also, this commit deprecates CONF.network_feature_enabled.port_security
in favor of the existing CONF.network_feature_enabled.api_extensions.

[1] I20b8d5d2a300c83a59bdb33374fc20447ce2ede3
[2] I1efd5c838aa0d73cc6e8864e3041eea25850198d

Closes-Bug: #1638487
Change-Id: Ib46712db4f47788f2832b4a5f442868edf46a2a3

commit_message:
[DNM] test migration with pinning

- this change is not intended to merge.
  in the future extra senarios like these will be
  tested using indivigual tempest test per nfv feature
  rather then via the global config settings.
- it modifies the job intoduced in the previous patch
  to use cpu pinning in the standard flavor and removes hugepages.
- it alter the realtiem flaove to use thread policy isolate
  and force the use of small pages.

Change-Id: Idee2a39c5cbfe65f74b1c6fd31014933cfc40c15

[{'created': '2019-09-03 12:05:44.000000000', 'message': "Add failover logging to show the amphora details.

When failover occurs, Octavia health-manager doesn't log any
information about the loadbalancer.  Due to this, operators can't
specify which loadbalancer got failed and which user was affected
by the failover.

This commit fix this issue by logging not only amphora_id but also
the linking information (e.g. loadbalancer_id, compute_id, ..)
when performing/completed the failover.

Change-Id: I9bdd6f2913c0da2b0772b4b694309ef993289360
Task: 34312
Story: 2005947
(cherry picked from commit 93e06a9239a0f4b2bcdcdca9e13e800e75b1f237)

commit_message:
Add failover logging to show the amphora details.

When failover occurs, Octavia health-manager doesn't log any
information about the loadbalancer.  Due to this, operators can't
specify which loadbalancer got failed and which user was affected
by the failover.

This commit fix this issue by logging not only amphora_id but also
the linking information (e.g. loadbalancer_id, compute_id, ..)
when performing/completed the failover.

Change-Id: I9bdd6f2913c0da2b0772b4b694309ef993289360
Task: 34312
Story: 2005947
(cherry picked from commit 93e06a9239a0f4b2bcdcdca9e13e800e75b1f237)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-29 11:05:45.000000000', 'message': "Handle events in separate IDL

While setting the event handler lock in OvnNbIdlForLb we found that
on each Octavia API call exception was raised that the IDL has
not aquired OVNDB lock [0].

It is because when we set the event lock name it is required to be
aquired on each transaction, even on the one passed by Octavia API, which
shouldn't be blocking one [1].

So to address this issue I added second IDL called OvnNbIdlForLbEvents that
watches only for events and has the lock name set. Previous OvnNbIdlForLb is
used only for handling Octavia API requests.

With this change, which in fact is not ideal, it is not required to add
long-living agent driver thread in Octavia. That would give us some more time
to address those architecture issues.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/ovsdbapp/blob/master/ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/transaction.py#L102
[1] https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/python/ovs/db/idl.py#L445

Change-Id: I6534ac7777cf2a1216c65110704c675d5160b051
Story: 2006196
"}, {'created': '2019-07-29 13:36:45.000000000', 'message': "Handle events in separate IDL

While setting the event handler lock in OvnNbIdlForLb we found that
on each Octavia API call exception was raised that the IDL has
not aquired OVNDB lock [0].

It is because when we set the event lock name it is required to be
aquired on each transaction, even on the one passed by Octavia API, which
shouldn't be blocking one [1].

So to address this issue I added second IDL called OvnNbIdlForLbEvents that
watches only for events and has the lock name set. Previous OvnNbIdlForLb is
used only for handling Octavia API requests.

With this change, which in fact is not ideal, it is not required to add
long-living agent driver thread in Octavia. That would give us some more time
to address those architecture issues.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/ovsdbapp/blob/master/ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/transaction.py#L102
[1] https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/python/ovs/db/idl.py#L445

Change-Id: I6534ac7777cf2a1216c65110704c675d5160b051
Story: 2006196
"}, {'created': '2019-08-01 14:43:14.000000000', 'message': "Handle events in separate IDL

While setting the event handler lock in OvnNbIdlForLb
we found that on each Octavia API call exception
was raised that the IDL has not aquired OVNDB lock [0].

It is because when we set the event lock name it is
required to be aquired on each transaction, even on
the one passed by Octavia API, which shouldn't be
blocking one [1].

So to address this issue I added second IDL called
OvnNbIdlForLbEvents that watches only for events and
has the lock name set. Previous OvnNbIdlForLb is used
only for handling Octavia API requests.

With this change, which in fact is not ideal, it is
not required to add long-living agent driver thread
in Octavia. That would give us some more time to
address those architecture issues.

"}, {'created': '2019-08-02 07:35:25.000000000', 'message': "Handle events in separate IDL

While setting the event handler lock in OvnNbIdlForLb
we found that on each Octavia API call exception
was raised that the IDL has not aquired OVNDB lock [0].

It is because when we set the event lock name it is
required to be aquired on each transaction, even on
the one passed by Octavia API, which shouldn't be
blocking one [1].

So to address this issue I added second IDL called
OvnNbIdlForLbEvents that watches only for events and
has the lock name set. Previous OvnNbIdlForLb is used
only for handling Octavia API requests.

With this change, which in fact is not ideal, it is
not required to add long-living agent driver thread
in Octavia. That would give us some more time to
address those architecture issues.

"}, {'created': '2019-09-02 14:36:13.000000000', 'message': "Handle events in separate IDL instance

While setting the event handler lock in OvnNbIdlForLb
we found that on each Octavia API call exception
was raised that the IDL has not aquired OVNDB lock [0].

It is because when we set the event lock name it is
required to be acquired on each transaction, even on
the one passed by Octavia API, which shouldn't be
blocking one [1].

The second issue was cached NB DB connection within the same
process [2]. We overcome this by using other idl
implementation that utilize modified
networking_ovn.ovsdb.impl_idl_ovn.Backend.

So to address this issue I initialize second IDL that
watches only for events and has the lock name set. First
instance of OvnNbIdlForLb is used only for handling
Octavia API requests. Second has the lock name set and
is cached by OvnProviderHelper class attribute, that makes
the event mechanism work.

While long-living agent driver would be released
the second OvnNbIdlForLb object could be used in OVN agent
driver process in order to handle events there and then
we could stop using second IDL in the OvnProviderHelper.

commit_message:
Handle events in separate IDL instance

While setting the event handler lock in OvnNbIdlForLb
we found that on each Octavia API call exception
was raised that the IDL has not aquired OVNDB lock [0].

It is because when we set the event lock name it is
required to be acquired on each transaction, even on
the one passed by Octavia API, which shouldn't be
blocking one [1].

The second issue was cached NB DB connection within the same
process [2]. We overcome this by using other idl
implementation that utilize modified
networking_ovn.ovsdb.impl_idl_ovn.Backend.

So to address this issue I initialize second IDL that
watches only for events and has the lock name set. First
instance of OvnNbIdlForLb is used only for handling
Octavia API requests. Second has the lock name set and
is cached by OvnProviderHelper class attribute, that makes
the event mechanism work.

While long-living agent driver would be released
the second OvnNbIdlForLb object could be used in OVN agent
driver process in order to handle events there and then
we could stop using second IDL in the OvnProviderHelper.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/ovsdbapp/blob/master/ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/transaction.py#L102
[1] https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/python/ovs/db/idl.py#L445
[2] https://github.com/openstack/ovsdbapp/blob/68d462d355a9c9f7e6b12f08f4dfb0b0b3d443b2/ovsdbapp/backend/ovs_idl/__init__.py#L51

Change-Id: I6534ac7777cf2a1216c65110704c675d5160b051
Story: 2006196

[{'created': '2019-08-22 09:45:31.000000000', 'message': 'New project request: airship/isogen

This repo will contain container based LiveCD image builders for
various types of Operating Systems. New approach to Airship
bootstrap will leverage Kubernetes cluster deployed on Live image.
Every Operating System has its own approach for Live image generation.
Airshipctl needs to run docker container with LiveCD builder for
particular Operating system. As it was decided on Airship Bootstrap SIG
airship needs separate repository for image builder scripts and
automation.

Change-Id: I8b3e13a83deb4a6acf25bca961ef57bd5090ee5f

commit_message:
New project request: airship/images

This repo will contain scripts and Dockerfiles for building
Airship supplementary images. Some Airship sub-projects may run
utility containers. These utilities may not fit to particular project
in terms of implementation therefore container image artifacts should be
moved to separate repository.

Change-Id: I8b3e13a83deb4a6acf25bca961ef57bd5090ee5f

commit_message:
[WIP] Add network policy gate

This change adds a network-policy gate, as well as multiple
scripts that provide the appropriate overrides for enabling
network policy in each OpenStack service.

Note that the policies are all currently allow all traffic. Each
service will have their whitelisted rule list specified in
future changes.

Change-Id: Ie66be98a9ab45b97bc17a0160e575b1efdafb814

Update json module to jsonutils

this PS to update the remained json moudule to jsonutils.

Also I wonder why i have to install 'latexmk' manually however it is already mention in bindep.txt"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-07-16 08:09:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Vishal Manchanda wrote:

> > > make: latexmk: Command not found
 > 
 > That's the reason of your failure.
>
> Thanks for the reply. I have installed 'latexmk' package. Now i am
> facing the below issues: https://pastebin.com/CZsEYzV7. Can you help
> me on this?

The docs zuul job handles bindep but tox itself does not handle bindep.txt,
so you need to use bindep manually. If you need to know what happens,
look at the gate job definitions (which starts from .zuul.yaml).

For local runs, you need to install packages shown by 'bindep -b doc'.

Note that I don't think it is a good idea to add it to tox.ini as it is already handled in the preparation steps in the gate job. In addition, package level dependencies are install by bindep in other gate jobs and it looks like a common pattern in OpenStack CI."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-07-16 08:12:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

What is the expected goal of the community goal needs more discussion.
I mean this commit does not finish the goal.
I see several things to be improved, but this review is not the right place to discuss it and it should happen in the mailing list or IRC.
I am involved in the discussion and if something is necessary for horizon doc I will update it.
There are more TODOs in PDF doc build in other projects. Compared to this, horizon doc looks straight-forward.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-07-16 08:12:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 29313, 'date': '2019-07-16 09:25:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Check if docker enabled before stopping all containers.

The set of tasks in tripleo-podman/tasks/tripleo_docker_stop.yml
are being used during the upgrade to ensure that all
services are stopped when upgrading from Rocky to Stein.
However, in Train docker does not have to be installed in
the system and this task would fail.
Adding a check before to stop the services only if docker
is installed.

Change-Id: I05fa46d3b53ece83867a2ccd5c931b0cac1209d4

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

Change-Id: I2608bd329507be5d52831357a68940d539558a20
Closes-Bug: #1831518

commit_message:
Update json module to jsonutils

oslo project provide jsonutils, and the other projects use it,
this PS to update json moudule to oslo jsonutils.

Change-Id: If4a8b598e29289fc454387a6132f8be7b6df007d

commit_message:
openstack-tox-molecule: replace success-url and failure-url

Fixed issue introduced by new logs browsing experience where
success-url and failure-url are no longer working.

commit_message:
Replace git.openstack.org URLs with opendev.org URLs

1. Replace git.openstack.org URLs with opendev.org URLs
2. Update url to latest
3. cleanup of .keys() from dict_object.keys() *in* operator

Change-Id: I1f800334c4e945bd242c13d8b606702e220b21f4

commit_message:
Update hacking version

Use latest release 1.1.0 and compatible changes w.r.t pep8

W503 and W504 are incompatible and we need to choose one of them,
we disable W504 for neutron-vpnaas

Change-Id: I84dcc7f322cd1b868f5362042e6a1a099e84d8eb

recheck'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2019-09-03 13:43:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Thanks, looks good to me. The failing monasca-tempest-python2-influxdb job is probably related to the bug in InfluxDB client and will be fixed in requirements repository [1].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/679608

Do you know if the PDF documents are generated in CI job and can be looked up as the job output?

build-openstack-api-ref job generates an empty page. That's because we still keep the API reference in the legacy markdown document [2]. Could we add a pointer to this document in the api-ref index page [3]? Probably best to do in a separate change.

[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api/src/branch/master/docs/monasca-api-spec.md
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api/raw/branch/master/api-ref/source/index.rst"}, {'account_id': 13348, 'date': '2019-09-03 21:19:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 13348, 'date': '2019-09-03 21:19:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 13348, 'date': '2019-09-03 23:27:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Thanks, looks good to me. The failing monasca-tempest-python2-influxdb
 > job is probably related to the bug in InfluxDB client and will be
 > fixed in requirements repository [1].
 > 
 > [1] https://review.opendev.org/679608
 > 
 > Do you know if the PDF documents are generated in CI job and can be
 > looked up as the job output?
 > 
 > build-openstack-api-ref job generates an empty page. That's because
 > we still keep the API reference in the legacy markdown document
 > [2]. Could we add a pointer to this document in the api-ref index
 > page [3]? Probably best to do in a separate change.
 > 
 > [2] https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api/src/branch/master/docs/monasca-api-spec.md
 > [3] https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-api/raw/branch/master/api-ref/source/index.rst

when build successful pdf file will show up under openstack-tox-docs link from zuul. As for linking to API reference markdown file, there already is a link from the monasca-api repo link in the pdf, also, since the reason for providing pdf is for reading docs offline the web links won't work anyhow"}, {'account_id': 13348, 'date': '2019-09-03 23:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-09-04 04:46:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Note that https://review.opendev.org/679777 changed the pdf file name to doc-PROJECT.pdf, please adjust doc/source/conf.py'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-09-04 04:47:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Retire networking-generic-switch-tempest-plugin

This project is being retired as it's not a real tempest plugin and
should not be shipped or used outside of networking-generic-switch CI.

Change-Id: I3c231583a2049d3df7a24f1f06a4a0c2729c7c26

commit_message:
Add event_time_to_live for panko config

By default panko keeps data for ever, exposing this will
help user tweak this setting and expire data periodically.

Change-Id: I20c75e7499fac871e79a4522c56d2a6b06ad6df7
Closes-Bug: #1843113

commit_message:
Add long-running provider agent support

This patch adds support for long-running provider driver agents to
the Octavia driver-agent.
It will fork a process for all of the enabled provider driver
agents at startup.

Change-Id: Ib7042bcc48b1dd5b37b671dd5e64728b71ab9542
Story: 2006250
Task: 35863

commit_message:
Drop support for --allow-multiattach

The ability to enable multiattach on the command line was deprecated in
Queens with the full implementation of multiattach enabling it through
volume type extra specs. This removes the command line arg and handling
for specifying it with volume creation.

Change-Id: Ifc0c874657f959266050cd1a7a40e6ecccc8c114
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of

Change-Id: Ie4199aba3261f78f3592301bfd1e3d0be9cc7444

commit_message:
Add disco-stein bundle to gate tests

The bundle disco-stein was in the dev bundles because
a bug with the Python 3.7 syntax prevented the success of
the deployment of HA clusters. This bug is fixed, we can
reintegrate disco-stein in the gate bundles.

Other small additions:
- removing sitepackages in tox.ini to avoid test env pollution
- skip_missing_interpreters in tox.ini set to False to avoid false
positives by skipping missing interpreters.

LP Related-Bug: #1823718

Change-Id: Ie4199aba3261f78f3592301bfd1e3d0be9cc7444

commit_message:
[WIP] Virtualenv-based devmode

With this little hack, if we mount virtualenv path and sources to
container, if you install anything in host venv, it will work within
container too.

Change-Id: I398865ce2fb79a66a3bad4a1ed8573a9e9f3e4c4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-09 17:37:15.000000000', 'message': "Use blockinfile for tripleo-ssh-known-hosts

lineinfile combined with with_items was very inefficient for this task.
Given that each node's hostkey is added to every other host, it resulted
in O(n¬≤) performance.

Additional networks per node also worsened the problem. For example, in
a 100 node deployment, with 4 networks per node, this task would need to
be executed 40,000 times (100 * 100 * 4).

Switching to use blockinfile brings the performance back to O(n), and
also removes any dependency on the number of networks per node. This
change also backports the task layout which improves general performance
and functionality of the role.

Change-Id: Id51d27f53abf3421c29a11065377e9303ad68d79
(cherry picked from commit 4157d7a5df083a49bfb3b1d1c7cd5f233c1930c4)

commit_message:
Use blockinfile for tripleo-ssh-known-hosts

lineinfile combined with with_items was very inefficient for this task.
Given that each node's hostkey is added to every other host, it resulted
in O(n¬≤) performance.

Additional networks per node also worsened the problem. For example, in
a 100 node deployment, with 4 networks per node, this task would need to
be executed 40,000 times (100 * 100 * 4).

Switching to use blockinfile brings the performance back to O(n), and
also removes any dependency on the number of networks per node. This
change also backports the task layout which improves general performance
and functionality of the role.

Change-Id: Id51d27f53abf3421c29a11065377e9303ad68d79
(cherry picked from commit 4157d7a5df083a49bfb3b1d1c7cd5f233c1930c4)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

Remove unused 'not_list' template argument

This is unused in Horizon itself and I didn't find any
references in plugins. Undefined variable leads to
errors during render in a debug mode.

The upgrade tasks still fail with https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1826179 . My guess is that the links in /etc/puppet/modules to /usr/share/openstack-puppet/modules/* are not correct symlinked and therefore we fail in [1]. 

Also we need a post_upgrade_tasks to remove the nova_placement container. I'll update the patch for that.

good catch!

it seems that master repo still has stein puppet-tripleo rpm 10.4.2 version. https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-master-head/38/8f/388f96b348dc6c41aab892f7ed59aa64ecbff146_a8eef76b/'}, {'account_id': 17216, 'date': '2019-05-08 08:46:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

 > version. https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-master-head/38/8f/388f96b348dc6c41aab892f7ed59aa64ecbff146_a8eef76b/



so the issue is that in the master repo [1] we have 10.4.1 version and in the stein repo [2] we have 10.4.2 . For the upgrade ci tests we get 10.4.2 (which does not include the placement manifest) with the initial install and when we do the upgrade to master the files from master gets not installed as the rpm has a lower version.

[1] https://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-master/current/

commit_message:
placement: Add nova_api data extraction step during deployment

This change adds an additional deployment step that will attempt to
extract all Placement data from the nova_api database ahead of db syncs
being preformed. For the time being this is a noop as there should be no
data to move across. Eventually this will be used during upgrades and
actually used to migrate data between the nova_api and placement
database.

Co-Authored-By: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ifaa1101d05b835529730002ef985990c6469a449

commit_message:
Fix container validation after overcloud update.

The current validation script is tuned to docker.  We switch to podman
and adjust the expected output.

Change-Id: I06949a8b63dba58761e901584c1e49b4f63d2356
Closes-Bug: #1843023

commit_message:
Disable train cinder consistency group support

Cinder consistency group support was removed from upstream horizon
as of Train, and has been replaced by the generic group feature.

Change-Id: Iebf4d441b36e7c31b200205cd9bbee0d1fb9a47c
Closes-Bug: #1841188

[{'created': '2019-08-20 18:47:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix quoting in zuul for tempest plugins

Something has changed and the quoting used in the zuul jobs
configuration no longer works. This patch removes the excess
quoting.

Change-Id: I9f5e103114496c6d06bc70aba2d51e26925aae6e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix quoting in zuul for tempest plugins

Something has changed and the quoting used in the zuul jobs
configuration no longer works. This patch removes the excess
quoting.

Change-Id: I9f5e103114496c6d06bc70aba2d51e26925aae6e

commit_message:
k8s_fedora: Set rp_filter=1 for calico

upstream docs:
Cluster nodes must have rp_filter set to strict (1).
https://github.com/projectcalico/calico/blob/master/v3.9/getting-started/kubernetes/installation/migration-from-flannel.md

story: 2006441
task: 36564

Change-Id: I828cec27968ffe0961011e34a66e0eef3e567c91
Signed-off-by: Spyros Trigazis <spyridon.trigazis@cern.ch>

commit_message:
Remove -u root as mysql is executed with root user

As openstack installation guides suggest to run mysql with root shell
user, mysql will not ask for password, so in
controller-install-*.rst "-u root -p" is useless.

Change-Id: I1e5b7363787221c5bf51964fc61b017970a476fd
Related-Bug: #1785025

commit_message:
Optional filters parameters should be passed only once

This patch does the following :

1) Errors out if similar type of filters args are passed
Eg :
cinder list --name abc --name xyz
cinder list --name abc --filters name=xyz

2) Allows multiple filter parameters of different type
cinder list --filters name=abc --filters size=1

Change-Id: I2f8662555f830b0821147324849d04e7a29d0580

commit_message:
Add config option use_dumb_init to add it to container images

Usage of dumb-init can also be disabled from cli with
`--nouse-dumb-init` when building images.

Change-Id: Id32d54fc9913b83cf121ede5a5e265e0772062ae
Related-Bug: #1821970
(cherry picked from commit 767219dee8ac2df4d7a6d37ccad02b551483eb18)

[{'created': '2019-09-10 17:06:48.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I447b0ff53abd202abcb2a6699d31ac7e94577f66
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/train

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/train branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I447b0ff53abd202abcb2a6699d31ac7e94577f66

commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: Ib8a01b48222e640648438ccac709d85c3722234a
Sem-Ver: feature

subject: TLS: Support inter-service auth with intermediate cert
messages: [{'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-09-11 05:44:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2019-09-11 05:56:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2019-09-11 13:38:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-11 05:44:13.000000000', 'message': 'TLS: Support inter-service auth with intermediate cert

In a deployment where the certificates relation is used in
conjunction with a intermediate certificate we need to write
the intermediate certificate out along with the CA certificate
to allow for PKI-based inter-service authentication.

Change-Id: I57a6da4ea1fc041b3797609703f28c7720b36367
Closes-Bug: #1843530
'}, {'created': '2019-09-11 05:56:02.000000000', 'message': 'TLS: Support inter-service auth with intermediate cert

In a deployment where the certificates relation is used in
conjunction with a intermediate certificate we need to write
the intermediate certificate out along with the CA certificate
to allow for PKI-based inter-service authentication.

Change-Id: I57a6da4ea1fc041b3797609703f28c7720b36367
Closes-Bug: #1843530
'}]
commit_message:
TLS: Support inter-service auth with intermediate cert

In a deployment where the certificates relation is used in
conjunction with a intermediate certificate we need to write
the intermediate certificate out along with the CA certificate
to allow for PKI-based inter-service authentication.

Change-Id: I57a6da4ea1fc041b3797609703f28c7720b36367
Closes-Bug: #1843530

commit_message:
Add update share-type to SDK and CLI

Currently, only the name and description and public access of share-type
is set when the share-type is created, and not allowed to be edited
after the share-type is created. We can only set extra spec for share-type.
But not name or description or public access for share-type.

Change-Id: Ia0df0d46e11d0438e16fc910fc377f9dd4e85521
Partially-Implements: blueprint update-share-type-name-or-description
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/669651

commit_message:
check-plugins job: convert the job to tox

Previously check-plugins job runs a shell script in a playbook.
This commit converts it into tox env so that developers can run
the check job locally.

This commit also improves the output of check_osc_commands.

Change-Id: I280975f20b9dd5080bafb599440ed1c992648986

commit_message:
Add microversion support

This patch adds microversion support so that it is possible to make
minor changes to the APIs as required to fix Launchpad bug #1740091.

Change-Id: I7ea48be72897a77fc8424a57f4ce2d4798daf4eb
Related-Bug: #1740091

"}]
commit_message:
Avoid unnecessary operation of ovsdb and flows

Type of lvm.vlan is int and other_config.get('tag') is a string,
they can never be equal. We should do type conversion before
comparing to avoid unnecessary operation of ovsdb and flows.

Change-Id: Ib5f3012ea02b33c65e2815e36f98b16f299dc6f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-21 14:44:14.000000000', 'message': 'Change ip_lib decorators order

Change the execution order of:
- @privileged.default.entrypoint
- @lockutils.synchronized("privileged-ip-lib")

"synchronized" decorator holds the execution of the function until
the lock is released. Using the current decorator ordering, this
active wait is done inside the privsep context. This can exhaust
the number of execution threads reserved for the privsep daemon.

Change-Id: I3f2142c567702b0020ad83786b718d12cf72d6bc
Closes-Bug: #1833721
'}]
commit_message:
Change ip_lib decorators order

Change the execution order of:
- @privileged.default.entrypoint
- @lockutils.synchronized("privileged-ip-lib")

"synchronized" decorator holds the execution of the function until
the lock is released. Using the current decorator ordering, this
active wait is done inside the privsep context. This can exhaust
the number of execution threads reserved for the privsep daemon.

Change-Id: I3f2142c567702b0020ad83786b718d12cf72d6bc
Closes-Bug: #1833721

[{'created': '2019-09-11 10:06:44.000000000', 'message': 'Increase unit test timeout

In some cases, specially when the builder is low on CPU resources,
a few openstacksdk unit tests may timeout. Increasing the individual
test timeout to 30 seconds can help.

Change-Id: Ia6ee80a9cc75f72e591b07368902b87f6ef12289
'}]
commit_message:
Increase unit test timeout

In some cases, specially when the builder is low on CPU resources,
a few openstacksdk unit tests may timeout. Increasing the individual
test timeout to 30 seconds can help.

Change-Id: Ia6ee80a9cc75f72e591b07368902b87f6ef12289

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-09-08 18:31:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 21:

Shouldn't we be able to update share types by (unique) name? We can show them by name:

vagrant@ubuntu-devstack:/opt/stack/manila$ manila type-create Example --snapshot_support False False
+----------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Property             | Value                                |
+----------------------+--------------------------------------+
| required_extra_specs | driver_handles_share_servers : False |
| Name                 | Example                              |
| Visibility           | public                               |
| is_default           | -                                    |
| ID                   | 5af97d6a-4c7d-44cc-a9ec-e95fd941d5fb |
| optional_extra_specs | snapshot_support : False             |
| Description          | None                                 |
+----------------------+--------------------------------------+
vagrant@ubuntu-devstack:/opt/stack/manila$ manila type-show Example
+----------------------+--------------------------------------+
| Property             | Value                                |
+----------------------+--------------------------------------+
| required_extra_specs | driver_handles_share_servers : False |
| description          | None                                 |
| visibility           | public                               |
| is_default           | NO                                   |
| id                   | 5af97d6a-4c7d-44cc-a9ec-e95fd941d5fb |
| optional_extra_specs | snapshot_support : False             |
| name                 | Example                              |
+----------------------+--------------------------------------+
vagrant@ubuntu-devstack:/opt/stack/manila$ manila --debug type-update Example --description 'for testing'

> now we only support update share type by share type id, I consider a situation, if a share type's name is uuid like, and this uuid has exist in share type datebase,This leads to confusion,so we only support update by id.

Well we can create share types whose name is the uuid of another share-type, so we don't enforce this rule.  I also don't think in practice it will lead to confusion since no one would actually have any motivation to do this unless a cloud administrator wants to play a trick on another cloud administrator.

$ manila type-show Example

commit_message:
Add update share-type API to Share Types

Currently, only the name and description and public access of share-type
is set when the share-type is created, and not allowed to be edited
after the share-type is created. We can only set extra spec for share-type.
But not name or description or public access for share-type.

Co-Authored-By: Brin Zhang <zhangbailin@inspur.com>
APIImpact

Implements: blueprint update-share-type-name-or-description
Change-Id: I4c7bdd601d48b40c01639b5089d4bff259a7b3af

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-03 12:06:45.000000000', 'message': "Add failover logging to show the amphora details.

When failover occurs, Octavia health-manager doesn't log any
information about the loadbalancer.  Due to this, operators can't
specify which loadbalancer got failed and which user was affected
by the failover.

This commit fix this issue by logging not only amphora_id but also
the linking information (e.g. loadbalancer_id, compute_id, ..)
when performing/completed the failover.

Change-Id: I9bdd6f2913c0da2b0772b4b694309ef993289360
Task: 34312
Story: 2005947
(cherry picked from commit 93e06a9239a0f4b2bcdcdca9e13e800e75b1f237)
(cherry picked from commit f412d8521c79d9361c86dc1a1d74a119b1942b7c)
"}]
commit_message:
Add failover logging to show the amphora details.

When failover occurs, Octavia health-manager doesn't log any
information about the loadbalancer.  Due to this, operators can't
specify which loadbalancer got failed and which user was affected
by the failover.

This commit fix this issue by logging not only amphora_id but also
the linking information (e.g. loadbalancer_id, compute_id, ..)
when performing/completed the failover.

[{'created': '2019-07-26 07:36:01.000000000', 'message': "Use new ``initial_xxx_allocation_ratio`` CONF

This patch adds new ``initial_xxx_allocation_ratio`` CONF options
and modifies the resource tracker's initial compute node creation to
use these values.

During the update_available_resource periodic task, the allocation
ratios reported to inventory for VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB will
be based on:

* If CONF.*_allocation_ratio is set, use it. This overrides everything
  including externally set allocation ratios via the placement API.
* If reporting inventory for the first time, the
  CONF.initial_*_allocation_ratio value is used.
* For everything else, the inventory reported remains unchanged which
  allows operators to set the allocation ratios on the inventory records
  in placement directly without worrying about nova-compute overwriting
  those changes.

commit_message:
Fixing UT issues to support Python 3 Train Version

Change-Id: I5b779f093a465812dbca745ce4b226370b6a6bd5Use new ``initial_xxx_allocation_ratio`` CONF

This patch adds new ``initial_xxx_allocation_ratio`` CONF options
and modifies the resource tracker's initial compute node creation to
use these values.

During the update_available_resource periodic task, the allocation
ratios reported to inventory for VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB will
be based on:

* If CONF.*_allocation_ratio is set, use it. This overrides everything
  including externally set allocation ratios via the placement API.
* If reporting inventory for the first time, the
  CONF.initial_*_allocation_ratio value is used.
* For everything else, the inventory reported remains unchanged which
  allows operators to set the allocation ratios on the inventory records
  in placement directly without worrying about nova-compute overwriting
  those changes.

Merging Changeset:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/
08f3ae960623c94bdd997cacb3e81f04b4bbba69#
diff-46d49d172cae6b899c1be3628dede5d1

Change-Id: I29f6f1642a4c2855129d31bb333cc80020e4854b

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-14 18:23:43.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Separate mapping vs no-mapping code paths

The referenced story speculates that performance degradation since
introduction of microversion 1.34 (mappings in allocation candidate
results) [1] may be due to (a) increased object hashing cost and/or (b)
the new data processing in the output.

This commit separates the pre- and post-mapping data handling
completely, which should eliminate (b) for microversions prior to 1.34.

If the performance goes back to previous levels, (a) is not to blame,
and we may wish to merge (some variant of) this patch.

If the performance is unaffected, (a) is the culprit and should be
investigated further.

If somewhere in the middle, we may wish to merge (some variant of) this
patch as well as investigating (a).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662245

Change-Id: I45a6f73b17dbbce8fde931e90ab2cbea3e8bfcad
Story: #2005889
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Separate mapping vs no-mapping code paths

The referenced story speculates that performance degradation since
introduction of microversion 1.34 (mappings in allocation candidate
results) [1] may be due to (a) increased object hashing cost and/or (b)
the new data processing in the output.

This commit separates the pre- and post-mapping data handling
completely, which should eliminate (b) for microversions prior to 1.34.

If the performance goes back to previous levels, (a) is not to blame,
and we may wish to merge (some variant of) this patch.

If the performance is unaffected, (a) is the culprit and should be
investigated further.

If somewhere in the middle, we may wish to merge (some variant of) this
patch as well as investigating (a).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/662245

Change-Id: I45a6f73b17dbbce8fde931e90ab2cbea3e8bfcad
Story: #2005889

messages: [{'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-08-14 17:35:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-09-11 12:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nNo longer needed'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 17:35:41.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: sparse parent dict breaks _check_same_subtree

Following the discussion at [1], this patch exercises
_check_same_subtree with a parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid dict that only
includes providers involved in the request. In order to make this work,
the delta at [1] is put into place: this makes the recursion to discover
a provider's ancestry line stop as soon as it hits a provider not
involved in the request.

This causes one scenario [2] to fail: where there's a "hole" in the
ancestry chain for one of the providers, ancestors on the other side of
that hole are not counted in the ancestry line, so same_subtree can
return False when it should have been True.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675606/2/placement/objects/allocation_candidate.py@908
[2] I checked by commenting out that scenario - the rest pass

Change-Id: I077eef58a3e89fb402a6cdcb10e4f5688aed3f07
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: sparse parent dict breaks _check_same_subtree

Following the discussion at [1], this patch exercises
_check_same_subtree with a parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid dict that only
includes providers involved in the request. In order to make this work,
the delta at [1] is put into place: this makes the recursion to discover
a provider's ancestry line stop as soon as it hits a provider not
involved in the request.

This causes one scenario [2] to fail: where there's a "hole" in the
ancestry chain for one of the providers, ancestors on the other side of
that hole are not counted in the ancestry line, so same_subtree can
return False when it should have been True.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675606/2/placement/objects/allocation_candidate.py@908
[2] I checked by commenting out that scenario - the rest pass

Change-Id: I077eef58a3e89fb402a6cdcb10e4f5688aed3f07

a parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid dict that only includes providers involved in
the request. In order to make this work, the delta at [1] is put into
place: this makes the recursion to discover a provider's ancestry line
stop as soon as it hits a provider not involved in the request.

A gabbi test is written to demonstrate the problem: when there's a

a parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid dict that only includes providers involved in
the request. In order to make this work, the delta at [1] is put into
place: this makes the recursion to discover a provider's ancestry line
stop as soon as it hits a provider not involved in the request.

This breaks a gabbi test written previously [2] to demonstrate the

commit_message:
DNM: sparse parent dict breaks same_subtree (part deux)

Following the discussion at [1], this patch exercises same_subtree with
a parent_uuid_by_rp_uuid dict that only includes providers involved in
the request. In order to make this work, the delta at [1] is put into
place: this makes the recursion to discover a provider's ancestry line
stop as soon as it hits a provider not involved in the request.

This breaks a gabbi test written previously [2] to demonstrate the
problem: when there's a "hole" in the ancestry chain for one of the
providers, ancestors on the other side of that hole are not counted in
the ancestry line, so same_subtree can return False when it should have
been True.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/675606/2/placement/objects/allocation_candidate.py@908
[2] I5062e725d6f29cd997b974a0dad7dc4d0ed2900f

Change-Id: Ib498fe29ecb7cefd49cf153de328061c09ef9061

commit_message:
WIP: Microversion 1.37: Adds support for consumer_types

Switched to a test and spec driven approach via a
consumer-types-1.37.yaml gabbit. That identified some issues
which are starting to be addressed, but still plenty more to do.

Reshaper now works. Now this needs to be split up and cleaned up.

Change-Id: I441422078609a14c37d9ded7b0741161297dd2ce

Change openstack-dev to openstack-discuss

Mailinglists have been updated. Openstack-discuss replaces openstack-dev.

Change-Id: I62bfd4200507f8717953a4a0e1c100d15dc74ba3

Update docs to refer to PROJECT instead of TENANT

Updates several references for things like OS_TENANT_NAME and
--os-tenant-name.

Change-Id: If71710740b4d4573a1b3f515a5762a4f82bc727d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

I didn't see anything in the release notes, but then the change from 'tenant' to 'project' talk most likely predates the release notes.  I think at this point, most people know to talk about projects.  I guess there's no point doing the silent acceptance of deprecated options? (I haven't been working on cinder too long, this has probably all been hashed out already.)"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-18 20:44:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I think that deprecation predates the use of reno.

We could continue to accept the old form. But I think at some point we should enforce some consistency on using the expected form and clean up the extra code to provide compatibility. I believe keystone and possibly other libs will emit a deprecation warning if OS_TENANT_* is set, so I would rather clean this up now while we are considering doing a major version bump.

My opinion of course, but others should feel free to provide input.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-20 13:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2019-04-20 23:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Good point about the major version bump.  I think it makes sense to accept only "project talk" in the new major version.'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2019-05-01 06:14:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

LGTM!'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-05-01 16:01:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Drop support for OS_TENANT_NAME and OS_TENANT_ID

These have been deprecated for a very long time now. Switch to only
support the current OS_PROJECT_NAME and OS_PROJECT_ID.

Change-Id: I2fb78768b4308a3aaf12764edadb58d4a307adaa
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-11 06:05:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix timeout Zuul changes

Change I90cbfdaad582900f3047acffbfcdd3189335ffbf added a timeout for
lower-constraints only to check queue but missed gate, add it there.

Change I0b9e0fbbd1760fe2d55935592f4349f337801209 added tox-cover to gate
but it is never run in gate, see
https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L416
Remove it again.

Change-Id: I78eaa450cdb7a84d9a81e2354a97617681babc40
'}]
commit_message:
Fix timeout Zuul changes

Change I90cbfdaad582900f3047acffbfcdd3189335ffbf added a timeout for
lower-constraints only to check queue but missed gate, add it there.

Change I0b9e0fbbd1760fe2d55935592f4349f337801209 added tox-cover to gate
but it is never run in gate, see
https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-zuul-jobs/src/branch/master/zuul.d/project-templates.yaml#L416
Remove it again.

Change-Id: I78eaa450cdb7a84d9a81e2354a97617681babc40

commit_message:
Update default CRUSH algorithm to straw2

straw2 has been the default CRUSH algorithm since hammer
and Ubuntu Xenial ships with Jewel, meaning that straw2
is the default in all current LTS releases.

Change-Id: I6fa4072eb33d763aca5721ee9fdd30b60d468a44
Closes-Bug: #1836092

commit_message:
Unbreak CI: fluentd

fluentd - we are not deploying kubernetes, no need for plugins

In the original commit we also dropped Tripleo from the gate, but in
Rocky the Tripleo job did not exist.

Change-Id: I203f70176af7f2b53398ddeb5c21e6234a45e268
Signed-off-by: Rados≈Çaw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-02-05 06:43:07.000000000', 'message': 'To keep the backward comaptability with V1 driver.

If we are using v2 driver bgpvpn update commands were failing with error
thrown by update_bgpvpn_precommit method.

This id due to method signature difference of update_bgpvpn_precommit method
in networking-odl.

This commit will keep that backward compatibility with v1 driver.

Change-Id: I0d0c5c60e05b21a0c0878b1693355703036141d3
Signed-off-by: Yenuganti Vasudha <yenuganti.vasudha@ericsson.com>
Fixes Bug #1720057

commit_message:
The v2 driver interface from networking-odl for managing a neutron bgpvpn
should match the signature imposed by the driver-api of networking-bgpvpn.

However, we noticed that the signature of update_bgpvpn_precommit method
was incorrect compared to the networking-bgpvpn driver_api.py.

https://github.com/openstack/networking-bgpvpn/blob/master/networking_bgpvpn/
neutron/services/service_drivers/driver_api.py#L265

This review fixes the signature in our ODL v2 driver for bgpvpn to enable
the update_bgpvpn functionality to work.

Change-Id: I0d0c5c60e05b21a0c0878b1693355703036141d3
Signed-off-by: Yenuganti Vasudha <yenuganti.vasudha@ericsson.com>
Closes-Bug:#1720057

Yep, as Michael points out, there is absolutely nothing about cleanup here -- such that I didn't even remember that would be a thing we'd need to do. :D
I assume this is just leaving cinder volumes sitting around after LB deletes? And if there's failures at any stage between creating the volume and creating the amp with it..."}, {'account_id': 23871, 'date': '2019-08-29 17:41:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 38.'}, {'account_id': 23871, 'date': '2019-08-29 17:49:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 38:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 23871, 'date': '2019-08-30 14:52:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 39:

> Yep, as Michael points out, there is absolutely nothing about
 > cleanup here -- such that I didn't even remember that would be a
 > thing we'd need to do. :D
 > I assume this is just leaving cinder volumes sitting around after
 > LB deletes? And if there's failures at any stage between creating
 > the volume and creating the amp with it...

Regarding amphora volume management, it could be 3 options:
1. Switch on parameter delete-on-termination in nova block device mapping, therefore rely on nova for volume deletion,
2. Switch this parameter off and always delete volumes by nova compute driver after nova instance deletion,
3. Add a paramter to .conf file and leave decision up to admin."}, {'account_id': 27488, 'date': '2019-08-31 07:03:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 39:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14200, 'date': '2019-08-31 18:49:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 39: Backport-Candidate+1 Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23871, 'date': '2019-09-01 19:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 39: Backport-Candidate+1'}, {'account_id': 16198, 'date': '2019-09-02 08:37:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 39: Backport-Candidate+1'}, {'account_id': 16198, 'date': '2019-09-02 08:37:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 39: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30568, 'date': '2019-09-04 08:56:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 39: Backport-Candidate+1 Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2019-09-09 23:15:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 39: Backport-Candidate-2

commit_message:
Support create amphora instance from volume based.

In some deploy production, using volume based instead of localdisk
to protect data and live migrate can perform.

This patch adds:
 - creation a cinder volume for amphora
 - boot amphora with cinder volume
 - config options for cinder client
 - unit tests for cinder functionality

Story: 2001594
Co-authored-by: Vadim Ponomarev <velizarx@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Margarita Shakhova <shakhova.margarita@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I8181ed696b9ab556e7741c08839d79167aff8350

commit_message:
Update setup.cfg to include project_urls

The content is based on what pbr does [1] and packaging docs [2].
The links chosen and the names used are whatever we like.

project_urls are used when displaying packages on pypi, the links
show up in the left sidebar under a project links section.
pbr's example [3].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/pbr/latest/user/using.html#setup-cfg
[2] https://packaging.python.org/guides/distributing-packages-using-setuptools/#project-urls
[3] https://pypi.org/project/pbr/

Change-Id: I0c8663b1ed495f141350fd023c78a6ff38bca29f
Story: 2005170
Task: 30915

Change-Id: Ie54fca066f3333d1d5d18a2c0e8f6c7d5042490b
'}, {'created': '2019-05-31 19:37:39.000000000', 'message': "Detect that SEV is required and enable iommu for devices

As was previously agreed, HW_CPU_AMD_SEV trait in flavor indicates that
SEV must be used.

When SEV is requested, set all virtio devices' iommu attribute to ``on``.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

Change-Id: Ie54fca066f3333d1d5d18a2c0e8f6c7d5042490b
"}, {'created': '2019-06-03 18:01:47.000000000', 'message': "Detect that SEV is required and enable iommu for devices

Change-Id: Ie54fca066f3333d1d5d18a2c0e8f6c7d5042490b
"}, {'created': '2019-06-03 18:06:42.000000000', 'message': "Detect that SEV is required and enable iommu for devices

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

Change-Id: Ie54fca066f3333d1d5d18a2c0e8f6c7d5042490b
"}, {'created': '2019-06-12 11:34:02.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Detect that SEV is required and enable iommu for devices

This is still WIP - the _sev_required check needs to be changed to
return true iff:

  a) the supports_amd_sev instance variable in the driver is
     true, *and*

  b) the allocations fed to spawn() show that one slot of
     the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource inventory has been
     allocated to the guest.

When MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT is included in the inventory allocations
for the instance, and the host is capable of SEV, we know that SEV
functionality is required, so the guest config needs to be tweaked
accordingly in various ways.  This change implements the first of
those tweaks, which is to set all virtio devices' "iommu" attributes
to "on".  Subsequent commits will add the other tweaks.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ie54fca066f3333d1d5d18a2c0e8f6c7d5042490b
'}, {'created': '2019-06-17 18:14:39.000000000', 'message': 'Detect that SEV is required and enable iommu for devices

Add a new _sev_required() method to the libvirt driver to detect that
SEV is required and return True iff the following are both true:

  a) the supports_amd_sev instance variable in the driver is
     true, *and*

  b) the instance extra specs and/or image properties request
     memory encryption to be enabled.

In this case we know that SEV functionality is required, so tweak the
guest config accordingly in various ways.  This change implements the
first of those tweaks, which is to set all virtio devices' "iommu"
attributes to "on".  Subsequent commits will add the other tweaks.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ie54fca066f3333d1d5d18a2c0e8f6c7d5042490b
'}, {'created': '2019-06-18 01:03:42.000000000', 'message': 'Detect that SEV is required and enable iommu for devices

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ie54fca066f3333d1d5d18a2c0e8f6c7d5042490b
'}, {'created': '2019-06-20 20:39:43.000000000', 'message': 'Apply SEV-specific guest config when SEV is required

Add a new _sev_required() method to the libvirt driver to detect that
SEV is required and return True iff the following are both true:

  a) the supports_amd_sev instance variable in the driver is
     true, *and*

  b) the instance extra specs and/or image properties request
     memory encryption to be enabled.

In this case we know that SEV functionality is required, so tweak the
guest config accordingly in various ways:

- Set all virtio devices' "iommu" attributes to "on".

- Add the <launchSecurity> element to enable use of SEV.  Two related
  configuration values are extracted from domain capabilities and set
  on the element.

- Enable memory locking.  All the memory pages allocated by QEMU must
  be pinned for SEV, which is achieved via <memoryBacking> and <locked />
  elements.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: Ie54fca066f3333d1d5d18a2c0e8f6c7d5042490b

  b) the instance extra specs and/or image properties request
     memory encryption to be enabled.

In this case we know that SEV functionality is required, so tweak the
guest config accordingly in various ways:

- Set all virtio devices' "iommu" attributes to "on".

- Add the <launchSecurity> element to enable use of SEV.  Two related
  configuration values are extracted from domain capabilities and set
  on the element.

- Enable memory locking.  All the memory pages allocated by QEMU must
  be pinned for SEV, which is achieved via <memoryBacking> and <locked />
  elements.

Change-Id: Ie54fca066f3333d1d5d18a2c0e8f6c7d5042490b
'}, {'created': '2019-07-27 21:10:13.000000000', 'message': 'Apply SEV-specific guest config when SEV is required

Add a new sev_enabled() function to the libvirt utils to detect that
SEV is required and return True if and only if the following are both
true:

  a) the supports_amd_sev instance variable in the host is
     true, *and*

  b) the instance extra specs and/or image properties request
     memory encryption to be enabled.

In this case we know that SEV functionality is required, so tweak the
guest config accordingly in various ways:

- Ensure that the machine type is some q35 variant.  If the image had
  an hw_machine_type property requesting some other type, this will be
  overridden with a warning.  In order to distinguish between machine
  types requested via hw_machine_type vs. defaults from nova.conf or
  those hardcoded into nova itself, a new get_machine_type_no_default()
  function is introduced to nova.virt.libvirt.utils, together with
  accompanying tests.

- Set all virtio devices' "iommu" attributes to "on".

- Add the <launchSecurity> element to enable use of SEV.  Two related
  configuration values are extracted from domain capabilities and set
  on the element.

- Enable memory locking.  All the memory pages allocated by QEMU must
  be pinned for SEV, which is achieved via <memoryBacking> and <locked />
  elements.

Add a new sev_enabled() function to the libvirt utils to detect that
SEV is required and return True if and only if the following are both
true:

  a) the supports_amd_sev instance variable in the host is
     true, *and*

  b) the instance extra specs and/or image properties request
     memory encryption to be enabled.

In this case we know that SEV functionality is required, so tweak the
guest config accordingly in various ways:

- Ensure that the machine type is some q35 variant.  If the image had
  an hw_machine_type property requesting some other type, this will be
  overridden with a warning.  In order to distinguish between machine
  types requested via hw_machine_type vs. defaults from nova.conf or
  those hardcoded into nova itself, a new get_machine_type_no_default()
  function is introduced to nova.virt.libvirt.utils, together with
  accompanying tests.

- Set all virtio devices' "iommu" attributes to "on".  This is
  achieved by adding another check_set_sev() function which wraps
  around sev_enabled().

- Add the <launchSecurity> element to enable use of SEV.  Two related
  configuration values are extracted from domain capabilities and set
  on the element.

- Enable memory locking.  All the memory pages allocated by QEMU must
  be pinned for SEV, which is achieved via <memoryBacking> and <locked />
  elements.

In this case we know that SEV functionality is required, so tweak the
guest config accordingly in various ways:

- Ensure that the machine type is some q35 variant.  If the image had
  an hw_machine_type property requesting some other type, this will be
  overridden with a warning.  In order to distinguish between machine
  types requested via hw_machine_type vs. defaults from nova.conf or
  those hardcoded into nova itself, a new get_machine_type_no_default()
  function is introduced to nova.virt.libvirt.utils, together with
  accompanying tests.

- Set all virtio devices' "iommu" attributes to "on".  This is
  achieved by adding another check_set_sev() function which wraps
  around sev_enabled().

- Add the <launchSecurity> element to enable use of SEV.  Two related
  configuration values are extracted from domain capabilities and set
  on the element.

- Enable memory locking.  All the memory pages allocated by QEMU must
  be pinned for SEV, which is achieved via <memoryBacking> and <locked />
  elements.

commit_message:
Apply SEV-specific guest config when SEV is required

Add a new sev_enabled() function to the libvirt utils to detect that
SEV is required and return True if and only if the following are both
true:

  a) the supports_amd_sev instance variable in the host is
     true, *and*

  b) the instance extra specs and/or image properties request
     memory encryption to be enabled.

In this case we know that SEV functionality is required, so tweak the
guest config accordingly in various ways:

- Ensure that the machine type is some q35 variant.  If the image had
  an hw_machine_type property requesting some other type, an
  InvalidMachineType exception will be raised.

- Set the "iommu" attribute to "on" for all relevant devices including
  disk / network devices, but excluding input/graphics/video/serial
  devices.  This is achieved via a new set_driver_iommu_for_sev()
  method added to nova.virt.libvirt.designer.  In order to test this
  thoroughly, beef up the fake KVM guest fixture with extra devices
  of each type.

- Add the <launchSecurity> element to enable use of SEV.  Two related
  configuration values are extracted from domain capabilities and set
  on the element.

- Enable memory locking.  All the memory pages allocated by QEMU must
  be pinned for SEV, which is achieved via <memoryBacking> and <locked />
  elements.

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-11 10:20:32.000000000', 'message': 'Update Spec: Add support for VNF packages

The node template name of type tosca.nodes.nfv.Vdu.Compute fulfills the
purpose of the "SwImageDescId" attribute of the SwImageDesc information
element in ETSI GS NFV-IFA 011 [1] and hence it will be used in APIs to
identify the software image id from the VNFD perspective.
Please refer to clauses  6.8.3.7 and 6.8.4.7 of ETSI GS NFV-SOL 001 V2.6.1 [1].
During processing of vnf package, we can read the software images and
set software_image_id with the name of the node template name.

For example:
    VDU1:
      type: tosca.nodes.nfv.Vdu.Compute
      properties:
        name: my_vdu1
        description: VDU1 compute node
        vdu_profile:
          min_number_of_instances: 1
          max_number_of_instances: 1
        sw_image_data:
          name: Software of VDU1
          version: '0.4.0'
          checksum:
            algorithm: sha-256
            hash: b9c3036539fd7a5f87a1bf38eb05fdde8b556a
          container_format: bare
          disk_format: qcow2
          min_disk: 1 GB
          size: 1 GB
      artifacts:
        sw_image:
          type: tosca.artifacts.nfv.SwImage
          file: Files/images/cirros-0.4.0-x86_64-disk.img

In this case, software_image_id will be set to VDU1.

A VNF can contain multiple deployment flavours and when VNF will be
instantiated, flavour will be passed in the request.
Added `vnf_deployment_flavors` db table so that we can validate the request
directly from the information stored in the db table instead of parsing CSAR
file again and again. Also, changed the column names from 'flavor*' to
'flavour*'.

[1] : https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-SOL/001_099/001/02.06.01_60/gs_NFV-SOL001v020601p.pdf

Change-Id: I224d7f8f549f7fa1b86245c1275228670d3ed6ad
Blueprint: tosca-csar-mgmt-driver
'}]
commit_message:
Update Spec: Add support for VNF packages

The node template name of type tosca.nodes.nfv.Vdu.Compute fulfills the
purpose of the "SwImageDescId" attribute of the SwImageDesc information
element in ETSI GS NFV-IFA 011 [1] and hence it will be used in APIs to
identify the software image id from the VNFD perspective.
Please refer to clauses  6.8.3.7 and 6.8.4.7 of ETSI GS NFV-SOL 001 V2.6.1 [1].
During processing of vnf package, we can read the software images and
set software_image_id with the name of the node template name.

For example:
    VDU1:
      type: tosca.nodes.nfv.Vdu.Compute
      properties:
        name: my_vdu1
        description: VDU1 compute node
        vdu_profile:
          min_number_of_instances: 1
          max_number_of_instances: 1
        sw_image_data:
          name: Software of VDU1
          version: '0.4.0'
          checksum:
            algorithm: sha-256
            hash: b9c3036539fd7a5f87a1bf38eb05fdde8b556a
          container_format: bare
          disk_format: qcow2
          min_disk: 1 GB
          size: 1 GB
      artifacts:
        sw_image:
          type: tosca.artifacts.nfv.SwImage
          file: Files/images/cirros-0.4.0-x86_64-disk.img

In this case, software_image_id will be set to VDU1.

A VNF can contain multiple deployment flavours and when VNF will be
instantiated, flavour will be passed in the request.
Added `vnf_deployment_flavors` db table so that we can validate the request
directly from the information stored in the db table instead of parsing CSAR
file again and again. Also, changed the column names from 'flavor*' to
'flavour*'.

[1] : https://www.etsi.org/deliver/etsi_gs/NFV-SOL/001_099/001/02.06.01_60/gs_NFV-SOL001v020601p.pdf

Change-Id: I224d7f8f549f7fa1b86245c1275228670d3ed6ad
Blueprint: tosca-csar-mgmt-driver

commit_message:
Set uwsgi to be runned under the same interpreter

In order to run service under the same interpreter across all services
both wsgi and non-wsgi, we need to pass uwsgi_python_executable
while importing uwsgi role.

commit_message:
Move to using octavia-lib constants

Previously the samlple data models and driver agent tests used
strings for some of the tests. This patch corrects those to use
constants from octavia-lib.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673681/
Change-Id: I90c2fa386fab75742d07e89edd3fba8b56bb6aff

commit_message:
Set uwsgi to be runned under the same interpreter

In order to run service under the same interpreter across all services
both wsgi and non-wsgi, we need to pass uwsgi_python_executable
while importing uwsgi role.

Change-Id: If5b6dfc2a750ccc20ae078b46d8be855fe612d91

commit_message:
Set uwsgi to be runned under the same interpreter

In order to run service under the same interpreter across all services
both wsgi and non-wsgi, we need to pass uwsgi_python_executable
while importing uwsgi role.

Change-Id: Ibd951438cabd3a43c9dfa73099261830e688461c

commit_message:
Set uwsgi to be runned under the same interpreter

In order to run service under the same interpreter across all services
both wsgi and non-wsgi, we need to pass uwsgi_python_executable
while importing uwsgi role.

Change-Id: I6dcb0c5e170825e0d4718355ca8662e890a7c750

commit_message:
Support to create public trove instance

- The users need to specify the network to create Trove instance, but
  trove-taskmanager will create port in that network for Nova instance
  creation. Using port gives Trove more capabilities to define how the
  database service is exposed.
- Deprecate ICMP protocol for the instance.
- Restrict 'nics' parameter for creating instance.
- Add 'access' parameter for creating instance.
- Add 'public_network_id' option in order to create floating IP for the
  instance.
- Do not create records for security groups, but Trove can still delete
  existing instances for backward compatibility.
- Delete unreasonable Host, Account, Storage API.

Story: 2006500
Task: 36468
Task: 36466
Change-Id: I80827e1ad5e6b130cbf94c2bb7a909c44d5cf1e5

'}, {'created': '2019-09-10 14:24:27.000000000', 'message': 'Correctly set OS_TEST_TIMEOUT in the multinode CI job

commit_message:
Correctly set OS_TEST_TIMEOUT in the multinode CI job

DevStack variables do not affect how tox (and thus tempest) is run.

Also reduce the disk size since with 7 VMs we sometimes run out
of disk space on testing nodes.

Change-Id: I7ed6519a700b9bc9a215034b7ac9582f59ec85b5

glance: Simplify stestr run command

We don't need a SUSE/RDO condition for calling stestr.

Change-Id: I5105b3c8c687625601d1dfb56b828d842426354a

commit_message:
Decrypt Ceph keyring files using ansible-vault

This commit allows Ceph keyrings to be decrypted using
ansible-vault.

Change-Id: I0c841f40782480e405b1cbb4a5627b900e625f69
