revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-20 15:43:25.000000000', 'message': 'Track inventory for new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT resource class

Track compute node inventory for the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
resource class (added in os-resource-classes 0.4.0) which represents
the number of guests a compute node can host concurrently with memory
encrypted at the hardware level.

Initially this is required because on AMD SEV-capable hardware, the
memory controller has a fixed number of slots for holding encryption
keys, one per guest.  Typical early hardware only has 15 slots,
thereby limiting the number of SEV guests which can be run
concurrently to 15.  nova needs to track how many slots are available
and used in order to avoid attempting to exceeding that limit in the
hardware.

Work is in progress to allow QEMU and libvirt to expose the number of
slots available on SEV hardware; however until this is finished and
released, it will not be possible for nova to programatically detect
the correct value with which to populate the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
inventory.  So as a stop-gap, populate the inventory using the value
manually provided by the cloud operator in the
CONF.libvirt.num_memory_encrypted_guests configuration option, which
was added previously.

Change-Id: I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d
'}, {'created': '2019-06-20 20:39:43.000000000', 'message': 'Enable booting of libvirt guests with AMD SEV memory encryption

Track compute node inventory for the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
resource class (added in os-resource-classes 0.4.0) which represents
the number of guests a compute node can host concurrently with memory
encrypted at the hardware level.

This serves as a "master switch" for enabling SEV functionality, since
all the code which takes advantage of the presence of this inventory
in order to boot SEV-enabled guests is already in place, but none of
it gets used until the inventory is non-zero.

A discrete inventory is required because on AMD SEV-capable hardware,
the memory controller has a fixed number of slots for holding
encryption keys, one per guest.  Typical early hardware only has 15
slots, thereby limiting the number of SEV guests which can be run
concurrently to 15.  nova needs to track how many slots are available
and used in order to avoid attempting to exceeding that limit in the
hardware.

Work is in progress to allow QEMU and libvirt to expose the number of
slots available on SEV hardware; however until this is finished and
released, it will not be possible for nova to programatically detect
the correct value with which to populate the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
inventory.  So as a stop-gap, populate the inventory using the value
manually provided by the cloud operator in a new configuration option
CONF.libvirt.num_memory_encrypted_guests.

Since this commit effectively enables SEV, also add all the relevant
documentation as planned in the AMD SEV spec[0]:

- Add operation.boot-encrypted-vm to the KVM hypervisor feature matrix.

- Update the KVM section of the Configuration Guide.

- Add a release note.

[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#documentation-impact

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d
'}, {'created': '2019-07-24 10:59:57.000000000', 'message': 'Enable booting of libvirt guests with AMD SEV memory encryption

Track compute node inventory for the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
resource class (added in os-resource-classes 0.4.0) which represents
the number of guests a compute node can host concurrently with memory
encrypted at the hardware level.

This serves as a "master switch" for enabling SEV functionality, since
all the code which takes advantage of the presence of this inventory
in order to boot SEV-enabled guests is already in place, but none of
it gets used until the inventory is non-zero.

A discrete inventory is required because on AMD SEV-capable hardware,
the memory controller has a fixed number of slots for holding
encryption keys, one per guest.  Typical early hardware only has 15
slots, thereby limiting the number of SEV guests which can be run
concurrently to 15.  nova needs to track how many slots are available
and used in order to avoid attempting to exceeding that limit in the
hardware.

Work is in progress to allow QEMU and libvirt to expose the number of
slots available on SEV hardware; however until this is finished and
released, it will not be possible for nova to programatically detect
the correct value with which to populate the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
inventory.  So as a stop-gap, populate the inventory using the value
manually provided by the cloud operator in a new configuration option
CONF.libvirt.num_memory_encrypted_guests.

Since this commit effectively enables SEV, also add all the relevant
documentation as planned in the AMD SEV spec[0]:

- Add operation.boot-encrypted-vm to the KVM hypervisor feature matrix.

- Update the KVM section of the Configuration Guide.

- Add a release note.

[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#documentation-impact

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d
'}, {'created': '2019-08-15 18:23:23.000000000', 'message': 'Enable booting of libvirt guests with AMD SEV memory encryption

Track compute node inventory for the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
resource class (added in os-resource-classes 0.4.0) which represents
the number of guests a compute node can host concurrently with memory
encrypted at the hardware level.

This serves as a "master switch" for enabling SEV functionality, since
all the code which takes advantage of the presence of this inventory
in order to boot SEV-enabled guests is already in place, but none of
it gets used until the inventory is non-zero.

A discrete inventory is required because on AMD SEV-capable hardware,
the memory controller has a fixed number of slots for holding
encryption keys, one per guest.  Typical early hardware only has 15
slots, thereby limiting the number of SEV guests which can be run
concurrently to 15.  nova needs to track how many slots are available
and used in order to avoid attempting to exceeding that limit in the
hardware.

Work is in progress to allow QEMU and libvirt to expose the number of
slots available on SEV hardware; however until this is finished and
released, it will not be possible for nova to programatically detect
the correct value with which to populate the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
inventory.  So as a stop-gap, populate the inventory using the value
manually provided by the cloud operator in a new configuration option
CONF.libvirt.num_memory_encrypted_guests.

Since this commit effectively enables SEV, also add all the relevant
documentation as planned in the AMD SEV spec[0]:

- Add operation.boot-encrypted-vm to the KVM hypervisor feature matrix.

- Update the KVM section of the Configuration Guide.

- Add a release note.

[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#documentation-impact

concurrently to 15.  nova needs to track how many slots are available
and used in order to avoid attempting to exceed that limit in the
hardware.

Work is in progress to allow QEMU and libvirt to expose the number of
slots available on SEV hardware; however until this is finished and
released, it will not be possible for nova to programatically detect
the correct value with which to populate the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
inventory.  So as a stop-gap, populate the inventory using the value
manually provided by the cloud operator in a new configuration option
CONF.libvirt.num_memory_encrypted_guests.

Since this commit effectively enables SEV, also add all the relevant
documentation as planned in the AMD SEV spec[0]:

- Add operation.boot-encrypted-vm to the KVM hypervisor feature matrix.

- Update the KVM section of the Configuration Guide.

- Update the flavors section of the User Guide.

- Add a release note.

[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#documentation-impact

Track compute node inventory for the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
resource class (added in os-resource-classes 0.4.0) which represents
the number of guests a compute node can host concurrently with memory
encrypted at the hardware level.

This serves as a "master switch" for enabling SEV functionality, since

Change-Id: I659cb77f12a38a4d2fb118530ebb9de88d2ed30d

commit_message:
Enable booting of libvirt guests with AMD SEV memory encryption

Track compute node inventory for the new MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
resource class (added in os-resource-classes 0.4.0) which represents
the number of guests a compute node can host concurrently with memory
encrypted at the hardware level.

This serves as a "master switch" for enabling SEV functionality, since
all the code which takes advantage of the presence of this inventory
in order to boot SEV-enabled guests is already in place, but none of
it gets used until the inventory is non-zero.

A discrete inventory is required because on AMD SEV-capable hardware,
the memory controller has a fixed number of slots for holding
encryption keys, one per guest.  Typical early hardware only has 15
slots, thereby limiting the number of SEV guests which can be run
concurrently to 15.  nova needs to track how many slots are available
and used in order to avoid attempting to exceed that limit in the
hardware.

Work is in progress to allow QEMU and libvirt to expose the number of
slots available on SEV hardware; however until this is finished and
released, it will not be possible for nova to programatically detect
the correct value with which to populate the MEM_ENCRYPTION_CONTEXT
inventory.  So as a stop-gap, populate the inventory using the value
manually provided by the cloud operator in a new configuration option
CONF.libvirt.num_memory_encrypted_guests.

Since this commit effectively enables SEV, also add all the relevant
documentation as planned in the AMD SEV spec[0]:

- Add operation.boot-encrypted-vm to the KVM hypervisor feature matrix.

- Update the KVM section of the Configuration Guide.

- Update the flavors section of the User Guide.

- Add a release note.

[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#documentation-impact

commit_message:
Fix python3 compatibility of rbd get_fsid

In python3 librados's get_fsid() function is represented as binary.
This causes problems with nova rbd driver as we rely on get_fsid
return value, which should be string, not bytes.
Same fix is in cinder ang glance_store until librados will
be fixed.

Change-Id: Icbb0b341be19f87bd23064a2b4f98e68bf492a25

commit_message:
Get resource provider by uuid or name

This patch updates openstack resource provider (show|set|delete)
commands such way either RP uuid or RP name could be specified
as RP identifier.

Change-Id: I864920425b7ef27cb8dffc32d673059b56748661

commit_message:
Run only smoke tests in ipv6 job

'congress-tempest-ipv6-only' job is to verify
that congress is able to listen and run on IPv6
env. We do not need to run all the tests in this
job. Running only smoke tests should be fine.

This commit define the 'congress-ipv6' tox env which
include smoke test only as of now but it can be extended
to include more IPv6 tests if any.

Change-Id: Idbd4c6ea362487dd93330adddb26abc89387a726
Story: #2005477
Task: #35885

commit_message:
Reject live migration and suspend on SEV guests

As per the spec[0], live migration and suspend are not (yet) supported
for SEV guests, so reject them at the API level with an HTTP
409 (Conflict).

[0] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/train/approved/amd-sev-libvirt-support.html#limitations

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I69b6e153324a3e5680e096cd714e5d4dd05bae34

Add Huawei Ascend driver

This patch adds the Huawei Ascend driver.

commit_message:
Sync Sphinx requirement

Sync sphinx dependency with global requirements. It caps python 2 since
sphinx 2.0 no longer supports Python 2.7.

Change-Id: Ia60e0dbf34202f3b0dd9f49e44afb3c3ae4109a1

[{'account_id': 30842, 'date': '2019-08-20 11:19:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-08-20 11:49:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Store virtual media device changes persistently

Prior to this patch, ejecting virtual media was not communicated
to libvirt effectively  leaving virtual media inserted.

Also, changing virtual media properties has not been stored
persistently in the emulator.

Co-Authored-By: Ilya Etingof <etingof@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ib5505c9a5dbd55bba81bcd6bd5ba315e944e8896

commit_message:
Clean up app initialization and config

* Remove unnecessary code in OpenStackShell.initialize_app() - only
  the bits it instantiate our subclass of ClientManager remain
* Remove OSC_Config - with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678095/
  the last remaining required bit moves to osc-lib

Thos requires osc-lib 1.14.0

Change-Id: Ia4b3c737de9dc34949e74632441621014ef9eea9
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-06 11:12:22.000000000', 'message': 'Use created subnet in port generator in "test_port_ip_update_revises"

We are hitting sometimes a problem in "test_port_ip_update_revises" [1].
This happens because the port created doesn't belong to the previously
created subnet. We need to enforce that the port is created in the
subnet specifically created in this test.

[1]http://logs.openstack.org/69/650269/12/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/7adf36e/testr_results.html.gz

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/services/revisions/test_revision_plugin.py

Change-Id: I399f100fe30b6a03248cef5e6026204d4d1ffb2e
Closes-Bug: #1828865
(cherry picked from commit 872dd7f48400f0ee059876b01d4034aa75f97787)
'}]
commit_message:
Use created subnet in port generator in "test_port_ip_update_revises"

We are hitting sometimes a problem in "test_port_ip_update_revises" [1].
This happens because the port created doesn't belong to the previously
created subnet. We need to enforce that the port is created in the
subnet specifically created in this test.

[1]http://logs.openstack.org/69/650269/12/check/openstack-tox-lower-constraints/7adf36e/testr_results.html.gz

Conflicts:
    neutron/tests/unit/services/revisions/test_revision_plugin.py

Change-Id: I399f100fe30b6a03248cef5e6026204d4d1ffb2e

commit_message:
trivial: Remove vendored 'is_safe_url' function

This has been present since at least Django 1.6 [1], though the comment
on the removed function suggests it might have been earlier (pre-Git
days, perhaps?).

[1] https://github.com/django/django/commit/a2f2a399566

Change-Id: Ib6978ffa8d3962383fbc0a1c3cfd9da9e162f7dd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Bump timeout for lower-constraints job

In ba0dbdf we raised the timeouts for most of the tox jobs but neglected
the lower-constraints job which suffers the same timeout issues, so add
that one as well.

Change-Id: I213d6f91a815ba0dad5f5a04a5f0309722c91f62

I am able to copy support_matrix.css explicitly but latex is trying to copy that file again.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-08-27 12:49:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I am not a specialist of this area, but looking at the failure log carefully, the error happens when writing a file to doc/build/pdf/_static/ directory which does not exist. When I created doc/build/pdf/_static in advance, the sphinx-command itself succeeded, while make still fails.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2019-08-27 12:49:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-08-27 23:56:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)

I was able to do some comparisons with the similar patch from nova (https://review.opendev.org/#/c/676730). The reason the Nova patch did not ran into the support-matrix.css file not found problem was that it also includes the 'sphinx.ext.graphviz' extension, which also happened to create a file named 'graphviz.css' in the '_static' directory. In other words, the _static directory happened to be created because of the 'sphinx.ext.graphviz'. Sorta like dumb luck really. But fundamentally, we have a problem in the "sphinx_feature_classification.support_matrix". Just that the problem can be masked by including the 'sphinx.ext.graphviz' extension for now.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-08-28 00:42:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-08-28 18:17:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-08-28 18:35:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-08-28 20:43:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-08-30 04:39:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27621, 'date': '2019-08-30 05:09:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2019-08-30 15:25:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1916, 'date': '2019-08-30 15:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Generate PDF documentation

This patch adds a new tox job/command for building the pdf
version of documentation.

tox -epdf-docs

In addition to adjusting the infra requirement for PDF build
support, the following changes are made to build a PDF doc

- Download link of config_options, sample config and policy
  files are disabled for PDF doc as relative links do not
  make sense.
- Pre-create the doc/build/pdf/_static directory as a
  workaround because sphinx_feature_classification.support_matrix extension
  is operating under the assumption that the _static directory already exist
  and trying to copy support-matrix.css into it. We need to remove
  this workaround once the problem in the support_matrix extension is fixed.
- Use the toctree_only=True workaround to avoid TOC duplicate links.

Change-Id: Ief8df5f6a5a22b8d0530458ac45f344a72cc3e49

[{'created': '2019-09-10 12:12:44.000000000', 'message': 'Shrink the race window in confirm resize func test

New confirm resize functional tests were added in
Ia69dace6d3b395fa113c1382e8eb52c2cc36119d. But they could be racy [1]
because the migration allocation is deleted in placement as the last
thing in the confirm_resize process. So it happens after the migratin is
set to confirmed and the instance state is set to ACTIVE.

This patch shrink the window by waiting for the instance state as it
happens later than the migration status update. However the test still
can race.

[1] https://954d3ddb67e757934983-a9cc155153d08dd30dfffbbf1d71d234.ssl.cf5.rackcdn.com/676138/16/gate/nova-tox-functional-py36/fb5d235/testr_results.html.gz

because the migration allocation is deleted in placement as the last

commit_message:
Fix the race in confirm resize func test

New confirm resize functional tests were added in
Ia69dace6d3b395fa113c1382e8eb52c2cc36119d. But they could be racy [1]
because the migration allocation is deleted in placement as the last
thing in the confirm_resize process. So it happens after the migration is
set to confirmed and the instance state is set to ACTIVE.

This patch changes the confirm resize tests to wait for the successful
instance action event as that is sent _after_ the migration allocation
is deleted.

[1] see the bug report

Closes-Bug: #1843433

Change-Id: Ibeb16ce16263c43bad9f148480bbebca413d8117

commit_message:
Bump timeout for keystone tox jobs

The timeouts for the tox jobs for openstack/keystone have temporarily
been raised to 1 hour[1][2] while we work on making the unit tests more
efficient. To avoid the requirements gate facing the same frequent
timeouts, this change bumps the timeouts here too.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/680798
[2] https://review.opendev.org/681161

Change-Id: I6e88c790284da29ae15a021723281a4a539eb296

commit_message:
Remove system policy and its association from policy.v3cloudsample.json

By relying on system-scope and default roles, these policies are now
obsolete.

Closes-Bug: #1805409

commit_message:
ML2 plugin: extract and postpone limit in port query

as with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/656066/ if limit is applied in
any place other than at the end of the filters, sql alchemy will return
an error, and possibily we could return less result than intended.

Change-Id: I9a54ae99d2d5dfda63cb0061bcf3d727ed7cc992
Closes-Bug: #1827363
(cherry picked from commit 94bc403078b1e5d2cddc697fc59b7f1d2d8a6045)

commit_message:
Add periodic job to prefetch images into cache

Added new periodic job which will run as per interval set using
'cache_prefetcher_interval' configuration option and fetch images
which are queued for caching in cache directory.

DocImpact
Change-Id: If2875f7a215aca10a6ed2febc89b02219f90a10d

commit_message:
Implement system reader for implied roles

This change updates the implied roles policies to understand the system
reader role, and includes tests for system reader and system member. A
follow-on change will add support for system admin. For the time being,
we're deferring adding support for domain users to create implied roles
but may add it in the future.

Change-Id: I71f80eed5cd689505c7fd07f133e74f0e8edf66a
Partial-bug: #1805371

commit_message:
django22: Call 'is_safe_url' with 'allowed_hosts'

Per the Django 2.1 release notes [1]:

  'allowed_hosts' is now a required argument of private API
  'django.utils.http.is_safe_url()'.

This was actually changed in [2], [3].

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.2/releases/2.1/#miscellaneous
[2] https://github.com/django/django/commit/96107e2844d
[3] https://github.com/django/django/commit/1e81a4b897b

Change-Id: Ibfd61c7197602aad9a833280f74f50e7819a39dd
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I8190e0a4f169e1a3268f5e724c30a1c809739dd6
'}, {'created': '2019-09-10 15:35:47.000000000', 'message': 'Generate PDF documentation

This patch adds a new tox job/command for building the pdf
version of documentation.

tox -epdf-docs

In addition to adjusting the infra requirement for PDF build
support, the following changes are made to build a PDF doc

- Download link of config_options, sample config and policy
  files are disabled for PDF doc as relative links do not
  make sense.
- Pre-create the doc/build/pdf/_static directory as a
  workaround because sphinx_feature_classification.support_matrix extension
  is operating under the assumption that the _static directory already exist
  and trying to copy support-matrix.css into it. We need to remove
  this workaround once the problem in the support_matrix extension is fixed.
- Use the toctree_only=True workaround to avoid TOC duplicate links.

Change-Id: I8190e0a4f169e1a3268f5e724c30a1c809739dd6
'}]
commit_message:
Generate PDF documentation

This patch adds a new tox job/command for building the pdf
version of documentation.

tox -epdf-docs

In addition to adjusting the infra requirement for PDF build
support, the following changes are made to build a PDF doc

- Download link of config_options, sample config and policy
  files are disabled for PDF doc as relative links do not
  make sense.
- Pre-create the doc/build/pdf/_static directory as a
  workaround because sphinx_feature_classification.support_matrix extension
  is operating under the assumption that the _static directory already exist
  and trying to copy support-matrix.css into it. We need to remove
  this workaround once the problem in the support_matrix extension is fixed.
- Use the toctree_only=True workaround to avoid TOC duplicate links.

Change-Id: I8190e0a4f169e1a3268f5e724c30a1c809739dd6

commit_message:
Add python3 compatibility to horizon role

* Remove horizon_python_lib_dir, this is not used anywhere
* Autodetect the horizon_lib_dir for source installs
* Remove hardcoded python2.7 path from uwsgi template

Change-Id: I0747ad5c50c0c007385b4756f1b386363bafcf93

commit_message:
More aggregate functional race chasing

AggregateTests.wait_for_status() was a classmethod, those often
are sources of conflict in parallel testing...

Change-Id: I6211fd9c36926ca97de51a11923933d4d9d2dfda
Signed-off-by: Dean Troyer <dtroyer@gmail.com>

CI is happy now.'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2019-08-12 10:22:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> CI is happy now.

Hmm, there is a single positive result with DHSS=False and no corresponding run with DHSS=True.  The normal thing is for vendors to set up two jobs, one for each mode, and run both on each proposed chance so as to get full coverage.

The 'run-DellEMC Unity CI' instruction doesn't seem to trigger the job usually?"}, {'account_id': 14624, 'date': '2019-08-14 03:22:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> > CI is happy now.
 > 
 > Hmm, there is a single positive result with DHSS=False and no
 > corresponding run with DHSS=True.  The normal thing is for vendors
 > to set up two jobs, one for each mode, and run both on each
 > proposed chance so as to get full coverage.

We only have one unity array for both cinder and manila CI.
When we run DHSS=False, we need to manually set up a NAS server on the array, but when we run DHSS=True, we have to remove the manually created NAS server first.
So we have to work out some setup/teardown process to automate this if we want to run DHSS = True and False sequentially on a single unity array.
That would take some time.

 > 
 > The 'run-DellEMC Unity CI' instruction doesn't seem to trigger the
 > job usually?

As said above, we need to do some teardown/setup when we switching between DHSS=True and False. so it might be in the maintenancewindow when you trigger 'run-DellEMC Unity CI'

Could you approve this change first to add support for 'DHSS=False' to unity manila driver and then it makes sense to run both DHSS=True and False for upcoming changes."}, {'account_id': 14624, 'date': '2019-08-15 00:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

LGTM - please see comment inline for future commits, and question inline regarding the licenses. 

You need to update the feature support mapping: doc/source/admin/share_back_ends_feature_support_mapping.rst so that the information on https://docs.openstack.org/manila/latest/admin/share_back_ends_feature_support_mapping.html gets updated with this information.


Further, please pay attention to exceptions in the manila-share process when your backends are enabled [1][2] - there are some StringFormatting errors that are not being handled - I'd urge you to take a look and file launchpad bugs (https://bugs.launchpad.net/manila) and solve these issues.

commit_message:
[Unity] Driver supports the mode that does not create and destory share servers (DHSS=False)

Support 'driver_handles_share_servers = False' in manila.conf.
In such mode, need set unity_share_server in manila.conf, driver
will use this NAS server for share creation.

Change-Id: Iebc30d289fdb9f250e4951257313d630faa8bdf7

commit_message:
django22: Replace 'render_to_response' with 'render'

Per the Django 2.0 release notes [1]:

  'django.shortcuts.render_to_response()' is deprecated in favor of
  'django.shortcuts.render()'. 'render()' takes the same arguments
  except that it also requires a request.

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.2/releases/2.0/#id1

Change-Id: I2b66a23df6b6f3f389054515fe948828ec5cba40
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use status matching to avoid time comparison

To get leases that has been not ended, we checked if each lease end
time is later than now, but if we go this way it costs to join
all the reservation records since in reservation table has no column
to describe when it starts or ends.

To reduce reservation records to join, we add exact status string
matchig instead time comparison.

Co-Authored-By: Jacob Colleran <jakecoll@uchicago.edu>
Change-Id: I988f5abf319e094eecf99e3cee2ebb1900bc47ab

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-10 20:00:47.000000000', 'message': "Use of sparse images when converting

During the creation of volumes with images, cinder will try to convert
them when the image's disk_format aren't qcow2.

It would be interesting to consider whether we could benefit by
adding a '-S <sparse_size>' arg to the convert command, to do better
with sparse images. The sparse_size indicates the consecutive number of
bytes (defaults to 4k) that must contain only zeros for qemu-img to
create a sparse image during conversion. In this way, it would perform
better, and in the case of writing to a thin-provisioned volume, it would
write fewer data to it (so maybe faster to copy, but more importantly,
less space consumed).

Change-Id: I7b1fb6d17a5bb76eca50ea3909c02d942460718e
"}]
commit_message:
Use of sparse images when converting

During the creation of volumes with images, cinder will try to convert
them when the image's disk_format aren't qcow2.

It would be interesting to consider whether we could benefit by
adding a '-S <sparse_size>' arg to the convert command, to do better
with sparse images. The sparse_size indicates the consecutive number of
bytes (defaults to 4k) that must contain only zeros for qemu-img to
create a sparse image during conversion. In this way, it would perform
better, and in the case of writing to a thin-provisioned volume, it would
write fewer data to it (so maybe faster to copy, but more importantly,
less space consumed).

Change-Id: I7b1fb6d17a5bb76eca50ea3909c02d942460718e

commit_message:
api-ref: fix server topology "host_numa_node" field param name

The actual parameter in the response of the API is "host_node"
without "numa" in it so this fixes the docs to match the code
and sample.

Change-Id: Ie562d47e0fa7414bcdccf407b79e71e1aae8d708
Closes-Bug: #1843098

commit_message:
Fix NFS volume retype with migrate

When migrating a volume to an NFS backend, don't rename the associated
volume file if the original source volume was on the same backend (same
provider_location). Volume migration always deletes the source volume,
so the volume file should *not* be renamed to the original.

Closes-Bug: #1798468
Change-Id: Iadf537521af93bbd28452a54e0e70e7ed18f606c
(cherry picked from commit 33a3a4bf6fe72b093702922e2e5f102d06249375)
(cherry picked from commit 6f3bec3c64e27f7daac830e62de935b2d5ffa20f)
(cherry picked from commit 058700edc93a5815bedc8c7f53cccd672618019c)
(cherry picked from commit f3639046cbdc5202340ffd7a691c21ce3b6cc1bf)

commit_message:
Allow overlay tunnel endpoints on IPv6 address

Overlay tunnel endpoints are supported only on
IPv4 address. Now that OVS and Neutron support
having v6 endpoints, edit network enviroment
files in TripleO to allow this.

Change-Id: Ie2523cf4e359289298e4ea5d0992093976a19e04
Closes-Bug: #1793239
(cherry picked from commit fe8b808fd3859004e0de902fa82f43fa1998426c)

commit_message:
Allow overlay tunnel endpoints on IPv6 address

Overlay tunnel endpoints are supported only on
IPv4 address. Now that OVS and Neutron support
having v6 endpoints, edit network enviroment
files in TripleO to allow this.

Conflicts:
    network_data_routed.yaml

Change-Id: Ie2523cf4e359289298e4ea5d0992093976a19e04
Closes-Bug: #1793239
(cherry picked from commit fe8b808fd3859004e0de902fa82f43fa1998426c)

commit_message:
Add missing tests for module import in nova

There are some imodules imported in tripleo::profile::base::nova,
and tripleo::profile::base::nova::api but not tested.
Add missing these teses, so that we can check all includes are
working as expected

Trivial-fix

commit_message:
Use memcached for token caching in glance authtoken

Use memcached to cache token in glance authtoken, as in-process
cache, which we currently use, was already deprecated[1].

[1] Ied2b88c8cefe5655a88d0c2f334de04e588fa75a

Change-Id: Iba9c1df73c00e5eb314cb6bc2cda06ccd6ead96f

commit_message:
Run facts gathering always for upgrades.

Up to now, each of the upgrade steps to gather facts from the
Undercloud and Overcloud nodes did contain a tag named facts.
This allowed us to run the facts gathering at will, however
there is a problem with the upgrade_tasks. As it is allowed to
pass a specific tag during its execution. So, if the task passed
is different than facts, for example system_upgrade, then the
facts gathering tasks wont be executed and the upgrade tasks
will fail when trying to access some of the ansible facts (as
it could be ansible_hostname).
The solution for this is to run always the facts gathering, no
matter what tag is being passed we'll have the facts available
during the execution.

Change-Id: Ibee072bec9916804163dab29e164eb1423cd08f8

commit_message:
Add get method support to the driver-agent

This patch adds support for the octavia-lib to get objects by ID.

Change-Id: I98b399891488e5972ea4d332c06b55b34f20fb11
Story: 2005870
Task: 33680
Co-Authored-By: Adam Harwell <flux.adam@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Use htk function to directly hit RabbitMQ servers

This PS updates the charts to use the htk function
to allow oslo.messaging clients and servers to directly hit their
backends rather than using either DNS or K8S svc based routing.

Change-Id: I389de832740a59c0594e907177c8c2172a83958a

recheck'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-09-09 20:12:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-09-10 00:57:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 11952, 'date': '2019-09-10 01:50:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)

just a small nit on the docstring.
Also... do we need a unit test to exercise this?'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-09-10 02:35:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

re: unit tests, I generally find that ovsdb-related things work better as functional tests just because of all of the interaction between networking-ovn and ovsdb-server and handling event and having a database w/ all of the right stuff in it, etc. Also I hate a large percentage of the unit tests in OpenStack because they almost always involve specifying internal details of methods that may change, so any time even a small refactor is done it seems like you have to change the test, which defeats the purpose of unit tests. /rant

The other problem is that the real issue we are solving is with running nova evacuate when a host shuts down uncleanly. This seems hard to model very well in unit or functional tests, so I worry that any test we write limited to this codebase would be really artificial.

Others have suggested fullstack or tobiko to test a scenario like this, which seems like a good idea. But of course we don't have any networking-ovn fullstack tests and I don't actually know anything about tobiko.

tl;dr testing good. i'm not sure how, though."}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-09-10 04:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Published edit on patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-09-10 06:22:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

Thanks Terry!
I think that we should follow up on a functional test for the new event but you can do on a separate patch.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-09-10 10:56:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-09-10 11:24:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

This has had minimal changes since others gave their +2s, but most of the cores are on PTO right now, so I'm approving myself."}, {'account_id': 21798, 'date': '2019-09-10 11:27:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+1

Happy Zuul finally, congratulations!'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-09-10 14:50:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

reverify'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-21 05:01:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix evacuation when host dies uncleanly

If a host crashes and ovn-controller doesn't update clean up the
Port_Binding chassis column, the Logical_Switch_Port is never set
to DOWN, so we do not detect the up->down transition and update the
port status with the driver. This patch watches for Port_Binding
chassis column changes and if the port is up goes ahead and updates
the driver.

Change-Id: I8a5e6ad2e98b79a140977ce003609ed5b21e3499
Closes-Bug: #1840876
"}, {'created': '2019-08-21 05:40:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix evacuation when host dies uncleanly

If a host crashes and ovn-controller doesn't update clean up the
Port_Binding chassis column, the Logical_Switch_Port is never set
to DOWN, so we do not detect the up->down transition and update the
port status with the driver. This patch watches for Port_Binding
chassis column changes and if the port is up goes ahead and updates
the driver.

Change-Id: I8a5e6ad2e98b79a140977ce003609ed5b21e3499
Closes-Bug: #1840876

commit_message:
Fix evacuation when host dies uncleanly

If a host crashes and ovn-controller doesn't clean up the
Port_Binding chassis column, the Logical_Switch_Port is never set
to DOWN, so we do not detect the up->down transition and update the
port status with the driver. This patch watches for Port_Binding
chassis column changes and if the port is up goes ahead and updates
the driver.

Change-Id: I8a5e6ad2e98b79a140977ce003609ed5b21e3499
Closes-Bug: #1840876

Default to Cinder v3 API

This switches the default Cinder API version to v3 to prepare for v2
going away.

Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-08-09 12:26:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-08-09 13:21:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-08-15 11:07:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-08-29 09:05:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Code wise looks good to me overall.

However, when reading the commit message (and the LP bug) it reads as if OVN/OVS would now fragment while this is not the case. Let me clarify and perhaps Numan can add more light.

What OVN now supports is a mechanism to check if packets are larger than the configured MTU (especifically  for gateways). In this case, no matter if DF bit is set or not in the IP packets, OVN will emit an ICMP 'need to frag' to the sender. Before this, the packet would be just dropped. (The newest kernels add a primitive in the OVS datapath to be able to check if a packet is larger than X and this is leveraged by OVN 2.12+).

This is *not guaranteeing fragmentation* but we can expect most of the times that the sender host will process this ICMP and reduce the frame size accommodating to the PMTU.

It's still recommended a network design that mitigates MTU mismatches and we shouldn't expect this patch to handle all cases."}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-08-29 09:56:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Ah thanks for the explanation! I will update the patch and the LP to clarify the case'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-08-29 10:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2019-08-29 19:19:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-09-06 15:43:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

@Numan what's your take? :)"}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-09-10 13:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-09-10 14:34:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2019-09-10 14:35:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

'}, {'created': '2019-07-30 12:45:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add fragmentation support

This patch is adding support for fragmentation in networking-ovn.

A new configuration option called "ovn_fragmentation_enabled" has
been added and it defaults to False. Reason being, it requires a
specific kernel version for fragmentation to works (upstream >=
5.2). It's also possible to find out if fragmentation is supported
by running the following command as root:

$ ovs-appctl -t ovs-vswitchd dpif/show-dp-features br-int
(check for "Check pkt length action: Yes").

WARNING: Enabling this option without kernel support will result in a
real performance degradation.

At earlier versions of this patch we thought about having networking-ovn
to discover if this option is supported or not (by issuing that
ovs-appctl command above) but, since networking-ovn doesn't run in the
network nodes we thought that an upper level tool (such as puppet-ovn or
TripleO) could do a better job at checking if fragmentation is supported
and setting this option accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1838405
Change-Id: I089f95b40803a6cd5e01990acacd599ced3bbd91
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-07-31 09:10:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add fragmentation support

commit_message:
OVN to emit ICMP "fragmentation needed" packets

A new configuration option called "ovn_emit_need_to_frag" has been added
and defaults to False. Reason being, it requires a specific kernel
version for it to work (upstream >= 5.2). It's also possible to find out
if OVN supports that operation by running the following command as root:

$ ovs-appctl -t ovs-vswitchd dpif/show-dp-features br-int
(check for "Check pkt length action: Yes").

WARNING: Enabling this option without kernel support will result in a
real performance degradation.

At earlier versions of this patch we thought about having networking-ovn
to discover if this option is supported or not (by issuing that
ovs-appctl command above) but, since networking-ovn doesn't run in the
network nodes we thought that an upper level tool (such as puppet-ovn or
TripleO) could do a better job at checking for it and configuring things
accordingly.

Closes-Bug: #1838405
Change-Id: I089f95b40803a6cd5e01990acacd599ced3bbd91
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Stop hardcoding baremetal API version in stackrc

Long time ago it was required because ironicclient defaulted to
an ancient version. It was changed back in Queens (ironicclient 2.0),
so we can drop it now to avoid confusion.

This is the same as change Icea0bdf6d5dcdd81ce9c34be7af8a241da0861bc,
but adapter to instack-undercloud.

Change-Id: I106f5dc0ed4c3a3b67d8fc94c69b2b2f1d8fc547
Closes-Bug: #1789392
(cherry picked from commit 91016ffeef11ff657e30d7b0487a0935daf4b8c6)

commit_message:
Exit listing validations with a proper return code

When listing validations through the CLI, the return code was always 0.

This patch adds a proper return code management to validations listing
CLI by raising an exception.

Change-Id: I3171adabc639789b0ea805a140e4b1220ed4c93a
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 768d20cf2a3cad03da7333871e71b2fbc6d93eb9)

commit_message:
Stop hardcoding baremetal API version in stackrc

Long time ago it was required because ironicclient defaulted to
an ancient version. It was changed back in Queens (ironicclient 2.0),
so we can drop it now to avoid confusion.

This is the same as change Icea0bdf6d5dcdd81ce9c34be7af8a241da0861bc,
but adapter to instack-undercloud.

Change-Id: I106f5dc0ed4c3a3b67d8fc94c69b2b2f1d8fc547
Closes-Bug: #1789392

[{'created': '2019-08-26 20:42:49.000000000', 'message': "django22: Add 'request' as first argument to 'authenticate'

As noted in the Django 2.1 release notes [1]:

  The authenticate() method of authentication backends requires request
  as the first positional argument.

This can be seen here [2]. Simple enough, though it took me ages to
figure this out because Django gave me *zero* warning that a backend
because of this change. Heck, raising the TypeError would have helped :(

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.2/releases/2.1/#features-removed-in-2-1
[2] https://github.com/django/django/commit/5e31be1b96f

commit_message:
django22: Add 'request' as first argument to 'authenticate'

As noted in the Django 2.1 release notes [1]:

  The authenticate() method of authentication backends requires request
  as the first positional argument.

This can be seen here [2]. Simple enough, though it took me ages to
figure this out because Django gave me *zero* warning that a backend
because of this change. Heck, raising the TypeError would have helped :(

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.2/releases/2.1/#features-removed-in-2-1
[2] https://github.com/django/django/commit/5e31be1b96f

Change-Id: I0dd37d33c8e42a70c00a9f1460c1cec86c5b6006
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add parent project filter for listing projects

This patch introduces the interface into listing project, to
specify parent_id to filter projects which has the given project
as their parent[1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/identity/v3/?expanded=list-projects-detail#list-projects

Change-Id: If78030425468d4f99cba708540142871a2bf9190

commit_message:
Add defaults for rabbitmq managment and erlang bind addresses

These default to 0.0.0.0 and can be overriden in a real deployment
where the correct management network address is known.

Change-Id: If989ccee6449578316e2e8dbe502b6b17c7af9c5

mark'}, {'account_id': 10453, 'date': '2015-10-13 03:49:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I use ‚Äúqemu-img  help convert‚Äù and see this:
'-S' indicates the consecutive number of bytes (defaults to 4k) that must
       contain only zeros for qemu-img to create a sparse image during
       conversion. If the number of bytes is 0, the source will not be scanned    
for unallocated or zero sectors, and the destination image will always be
       fully allocated.

So it's not fully allocated with my qemu-img version 1.5.3 by default."}, {'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2015-10-19 16:14:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-10-19 17:43:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

commit_message:
Enable sparse image conversion

When converting a downloaded image with qemu-img
convert, the full image size is written to the destination
volume.

Add a sparse parameter which defaults to False, which
converts using qemu-img's sparse block detection.  This
allows the output to be written with sparse chunks (here,
set to 1MB).

We may want to add a configuration option for this,
but it seems reasonable as a starting point to let volume
drivers opt into it as appropriate.

The LVM driver uses this method if it is using thin
provisioning.

Change-Id: If5247d94c453cb31ddd31093de3bd1dca035d86e

commit_message:
Mark Huawei Fusionstorage Driver Unsupported

The Fusionstorage driver has failed to demonstrate Pyton3.7
support as was required during the Train release.  As
a result the driver is being marked unsupported and will
be removed in the 'U' release if support is not
demonstrated via 3rd Party CI.

Change-Id: Ia2ac09e43718c0064f21565157191698728a5bee

commit_message:
Use resource layer for compute flavors

Push the extra logic down into the proxy and resource layer. This
also removes the normalize functions for flavor and has the cloud
layer just return Resource objects. (yay!)
Flavor.extra_specs will not be re-fetched by default if not retured by
server. Some methods accept `get_extra` flag to request it.

Change-Id: Ie1441f5e882c5c235ac22687e0b96b986ebf38f9

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-10 10:52:15.000000000', 'message': 'Remove mock patching of jsonschema

Upper constraint version of jsonschema got bumped to major version 3 [1].
This broke unit tests TestAmphoraDriver.test_validate_flavor in amphora
driver v1 and v2. This patch fixes unit failures by removing unecessary
mocking of jsonschema.validators.requests. Tests will still pass on
lower constraint jsonschema==2.6.0.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649789/

Change-Id: I1cfc963cc40b73e4b83630832003f98baffdc0f2
'}]
commit_message:
Remove mock patching of jsonschema

Upper constraint version of jsonschema got bumped to major version 3 [1].
This broke unit tests TestAmphoraDriver.test_validate_flavor in amphora
driver v1 and v2. This patch fixes unit failures by removing unecessary
mocking of jsonschema.validators.requests. Tests will still pass on
lower constraint jsonschema==2.6.0.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649789/

Change-Id: I1cfc963cc40b73e4b83630832003f98baffdc0f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-09 13:02:23.000000000', 'message': 'SELinux: correct type for /var/log/containers

The correct type for this directory is "container_file_t" (or
svirt_sandbox_file_t). The var_log_t was needed before in order to allow
syslog to write HAProxy logs in /var/log/containers/haproxy.

This is not needed anymore, since a patch in openstack-selinux[1] allows
syslog to have a full access to container_file_t type.
Moreover, since we have logrotate running in a container, it mounts the
/var/log/containers location with ":z" flag, which re-labels all the
files to container_file_t.

[1] https://github.com/redhat-openstack/openstack-selinux/commit/f9b45cede356c0e09f78ffb8a3c01fb80b6aac36

Change-Id: I13a90695686b9134f6fcceac1bf6d22c2ac390a5
(cherry picked from commit 9fc00f14d4493c831aa48fb4be45c01d6c0111d1)
'}]
commit_message:
SELinux: correct type for /var/log/containers

The correct type for this directory is "container_file_t" (or
svirt_sandbox_file_t). The var_log_t was needed before in order to allow
syslog to write HAProxy logs in /var/log/containers/haproxy.

This is not needed anymore, since a patch in openstack-selinux[1] allows
syslog to have a full access to container_file_t type.
Moreover, since we have logrotate running in a container, it mounts the
/var/log/containers location with ":z" flag, which re-labels all the
files to container_file_t.

[1] https://github.com/redhat-openstack/openstack-selinux/commit/f9b45cede356c0e09f78ffb8a3c01fb80b6aac36

Change-Id: I13a90695686b9134f6fcceac1bf6d22c2ac390a5
(cherry picked from commit 9fc00f14d4493c831aa48fb4be45c01d6c0111d1)

The headless chrome container is used by the tempest-tripleo-ui plugin
which is configured right above the new location.  It makes more sense
to keep those together, instead of insisting on keeping container
configuration together.  The main reason is that when using tempest and
git for plugins we're not using containers for services.

Change-Id: I6ee03c8bd43f42397dda2d0c4847dcf8134e1125

commit_message:
Move headless chrome config to configure-tempest

The headless chrome container is used by the tempest-tripleo-ui plugin
which is configured right above the new location.  It makes more sense
to keep those together, instead of insisting on keeping container
configuration together.  The main reason is that when using tempest and
git for plugins we're not using containers for services.

Change-Id: I6ee03c8bd43f42397dda2d0c4847dcf8134e1125

'}, {'created': '2019-08-30 08:33:18.000000000', 'message': 'Move to MariaDB upstream repo on Ubuntu

MariaDB in Ubuntu packages is backlevel (10.1).
All devstack gates are tested on MySQL 5.7 which is not compatible
with MariaDB 10.1, Neutron recently introduced a db migration
that breaks on MariaDB 10.1, but works on MariaDB 10.3.

Bumping up version to 10.3 on Ubuntu to match CentOS (RDO) version.

Change-Id: I16e4c40208912691e3015bfe2065ea0ce2358edb

with MariaDB 10.1.
Neutron recently introduced a db migration
that breaks on MariaDB 10.1, but works on MariaDB 10.3 [0].

Bumping up version to 10.3 on Ubuntu to match CentOS (RDO) version.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677221/

commit_message:
Move to MariaDB upstream repo and new version (10.3) on Ubuntu

MariaDB in Ubuntu packages is backlevel (10.1).
Devstack gates are tested on MySQL 5.7 which is not compatible
with MariaDB 10.1.
Neutron recently introduced a db migration
that breaks on MariaDB 10.1, but works on MariaDB 10.3 [0].

Bumping up version to 10.3 on Ubuntu to match CentOS (RDO) version.

[0]: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677221/

Closes-Bug: #1841907
Change-Id: I16e4c40208912691e3015bfe2065ea0ce2358edb

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4571, 'name': 'Steve Baker', 'email': 'sbaker@redhat.com', 'username': 'steve-stevebaker'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-10 12:41:57.000000000', 'message': 'Fix race in execution finishing

An execution state can go from RUNNING to SUCCESS between fetching the
last message from the websocket and polling the execution state. This
means the SUCCESS payload is never returned and the overcloud
deployment fails at the end with no indication as to why.

This change turns the output of the execution into the last payload,
allowing the calling SUCCESS logic to run.

Change-Id: Ic22021ba9a2717de199629e361c656e2f562fb38
Closes-Bug: #1842987
(cherry picked from commit b5b5cab61da98c8bcf2c4e52a6d8ce0108dcfc64)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race in execution finishing

An execution state can go from RUNNING to SUCCESS between fetching the
last message from the websocket and polling the execution state. This
means the SUCCESS payload is never returned and the overcloud
deployment fails at the end with no indication as to why.

This change turns the output of the execution into the last payload,
allowing the calling SUCCESS logic to run.

Change-Id: Ic22021ba9a2717de199629e361c656e2f562fb38
Closes-Bug: #1842987
(cherry picked from commit b5b5cab61da98c8bcf2c4e52a6d8ce0108dcfc64)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 14:51:31.000000000', 'message': 'Disable "of_inactivity_probe" in fullstack tests

Disable the inactivity probe during the fullstack tests. This probe
is not tracked nor controller during these tests and usually make
them more unstable. As seen in the bug report, in loaded CI nodes,
sometimes the probe raises an error, stopping the current test:

  reconnect|ERR|tcp:127.0.0.1:56401: no response to inactivity probe
    after 5 seconds, disconnecting

Change-Id: Id27326d5deae78ebfad1012efb507fde9e6c1453
Closes-Bug: #1833386
(cherry picked from commit d8078469a8693bfa637e607ed848b918e3048ec9)
'}, {'created': '2019-09-10 05:40:36.000000000', 'message': 'Disable "of_inactivity_probe" in fullstack tests

Disable the inactivity probe during the fullstack tests. This probe
is not tracked nor controller during these tests and usually make
them more unstable. As seen in the bug report, in loaded CI nodes,
sometimes the probe raises an error, stopping the current test:

  reconnect|ERR|tcp:127.0.0.1:56401: no response to inactivity probe
    after 5 seconds, disconnecting

Change-Id: Id27326d5deae78ebfad1012efb507fde9e6c1453
Closes-Bug: #1833386
(cherry picked from commit d8078469a8693bfa637e607ed848b918e3048ec9)
'}]
commit_message:
Disable "of_inactivity_probe" in fullstack tests

Disable the inactivity probe during the fullstack tests. This probe
is not tracked nor controller during these tests and usually make
them more unstable. As seen in the bug report, in loaded CI nodes,
sometimes the probe raises an error, stopping the current test:

  reconnect|ERR|tcp:127.0.0.1:56401: no response to inactivity probe
    after 5 seconds, disconnecting

Change-Id: Id27326d5deae78ebfad1012efb507fde9e6c1453
Closes-Bug: #1833386
(cherry picked from commit d8078469a8693bfa637e607ed848b918e3048ec9)

commit_message:
Use version test instead of version_compare

This test was changed to 'version' in ansible 2.5 [1].

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.8/user_guide/playbooks_tests.html#version-compariso

Change-Id: If27fde3a15e2b611cebdfd26af5b421475cb7488

commit_message:
Mark HPE LeftHand driver as unsupported

The HPE team mentioned that the LeftHand CI is no longer supported,
so we are marking this driver as unsupported for the Train release.

Change-Id: I0d75d2bed6f7b3e70e4477617b954db71b1240ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-04 17:02:16.000000000', 'message': 'Make ChunkedEncodingError less scary

Queens Octavia Amphora has annoying issue of dropping every connection
after 50 seconds of inactivity. As Kuryr watchers connect to K8s API
through Octavia load balancer, this produces ChunkedEncodingError
exceptions all around in the logs. This commit makes K8sClient catch
those exceptions, log a nice warning explaining the situation and
restart the watcher using the last seen resourceVersion.

Change-Id: I18c79164ec18e6dbafc0f489f1428ff3aa72f162
Related-Bug: 1842689

commit_message:
Make ChunkedEncodingError less scary

Queens Octavia Amphora has annoying issue of dropping every connection
after 50 seconds of inactivity. As Kuryr watchers connect to K8s API
through Octavia load balancer, this produces ChunkedEncodingError
exceptions all around in the logs. This commit makes K8sClient catch
those exceptions, log a nice warning explaining the situation and
restart the watcher using the last seen resourceVersion.

Change-Id: I18c79164ec18e6dbafc0f489f1428ff3aa72f162
Related-Bug: 1842689

subject: Push sort_key down to server for flavor filtering
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2019-07-09 12:11:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2019-09-10 18:21:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-07-09 12:11:49.000000000', 'message': "Push sort_key down to server for flavor filtering

In get_flavor_by_ram we're pushing minRam down to the server, but
we're sorting by ram in the client, causing us to have to fetch all
of the flavors. If we push sort_key down to the server, we'll get
the flavors back in ram sorted order, so the generator can short
circuit without actualizing the whole list.

Change-Id: I2fb10ec2f0ef1a76585784c93c6d4b75abae1130
"}]
commit_message:
Push sort_key down to server for flavor filtering

In get_flavor_by_ram we're pushing minRam down to the server, but
we're sorting by ram in the client, causing us to have to fetch all
of the flavors. If we push sort_key down to the server, we'll get
the flavors back in ram sorted order, so the generator can short
circuit without actualizing the whole list.

Change-Id: I2fb10ec2f0ef1a76585784c93c6d4b75abae1130

subject: Fix Nova cell search
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-09 13:45:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-09-09 14:10:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2019-09-10 16:45:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-09 13:45:50.000000000', 'message': "Fix Nova cell search

The output from `nova-manage cell_v2 list_cells --verbose` contains
an extra column, stating whether the cell is enabled or not. This means
that the regex never matches, so existing_cells is always empty.

This fix updates the regex by adding a match group for this field which
may be used in a later change.

Unfortuately the CLI doesn't output in JSON format, which would make
this a lot less messy.

Closes-Bug: #1842460
Change-Id: Ib6400b33785f3ef674bffc9329feb3e33bd3f9a3
(cherry picked from commit 7b636033ee5e40ba90bce1fa95fe5432e344acfc)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix Nova cell search

The output from `nova-manage cell_v2 list_cells --verbose` contains
an extra column, stating whether the cell is enabled or not. This means
that the regex never matches, so existing_cells is always empty.

This fix updates the regex by adding a match group for this field which
may be used in a later change.

Unfortuately the CLI doesn't output in JSON format, which would make
this a lot less messy.

Closes-Bug: #1842460
Change-Id: Ib6400b33785f3ef674bffc9329feb3e33bd3f9a3
(cherry picked from commit 7b636033ee5e40ba90bce1fa95fe5432e344acfc)

commit_message:
Fix Nova cell search

The output from `nova-manage cell_v2 list_cells --verbose` contains
an extra column, stating whether the cell is enabled or not. This means
that the regex never matches, so existing_cells is always empty.

This fix updates the regex by adding a match group for this field which
may be used in a later change.

Unfortuately the CLI doesn't output in JSON format, which would make
this a lot less messy.

Closes-Bug: #1842460
Change-Id: Ib6400b33785f3ef674bffc9329feb3e33bd3f9a3
(cherry picked from commit 7b636033ee5e40ba90bce1fa95fe5432e344acfc)

I assume that when this is called from the Nova API container after some cells have been registered (i.e. during an upgrade), that it doesn't run on the cell DBs. If you specify this option in the API container, it doesn't populate the top level DB on a fresh install."}, {'account_id': 17669, 'date': '2019-09-09 16:21:17.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from tmp to bp/support-nova-cells'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2019-09-09 16:22:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Do not fan out DB sync to all cells

Support syncing cell conductor DBs on a per cell basis so that a
cell can be upgraded in isolation.

Change-Id: I357510a05cacbb9f2cdddbbe9fd06acbce9468ac

commit_message:
Use version test instead of version_compare

This filter was changed to 'version' in ansible 2.5 [1]. Some jinja
expressions are also converted to use ansible filters.

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.8/user_guide/playbooks_tests.html#version-comparison

Change-Id: I91c23b1f138adae6951421d0edc3a94680e2c126

subject: Configure Zun for Placement (Train+)
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-07 20:45:45.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Fix Zun CI job

After the integration with placement [1], we need to configure how
zun-compute is going to work with nova-compute.

* If zun-compute and nova-compute run in the same compute node,
  we need to set 'host_shared_with_nova' as true so that Zun
  will use the resource provider (compute node) created by nova.
  In this mode, containers and VMs could claim allocations againest
  the same resource provider.
* If zun-compute runs in a node without nova-compute, no extra
  configuration is needed. By default, each zun-compute will create
  a resource provider in placement to represent the compute node
  it manages.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zun/+spec/use-placement-resource-management

Change-Id: I2d85911c4504e541d2994ce3d48e2fbb1090b813

commit_message:
Configure Zun for Placement (Train+)

After the integration with placement [1], we need to configure how
zun-compute is going to work with nova-compute.

* If zun-compute and nova-compute run on the same compute node,
  we need to set 'host_shared_with_nova' as true so that Zun
  will use the resource provider (compute node) created by nova.
  In this mode, containers and VMs could claim allocations against
  the same resource provider.
* If zun-compute runs on a node without nova-compute, no extra
  configuration is needed. By default, each zun-compute will create
  a resource provider in placement to represent the compute node
  it manages.

[1] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/zun/+spec/use-placement-resource-management

Change-Id: I2d85911c4504e541d2994ce3d48e2fbb1090b813

commit_message:
Do not use privsep context when listing the namespaces in fullstack

The aim of this patch is to speed up the namespace listing and
avoid overloading the privsep daemon during the fullstack tests.

Change-Id: I95f024684c864aa75506b08a5f904a55267d09a8
Related-Bug: #1833717
Related-Bug: #1811515
(cherry picked from commit 9c5f394b73812fb748695eb0834e2b1b569b7876)

commit_message:
Ignore configuration files

This commit adds configuration files to .gitignore and renames them to
*.sample because we change them in individual development environment.
And this commit leave etc/report/config.json file because it's needed
for evaluating UI changes on the gate. We may need to change it to more
sophisticated solution in the future, though.

Change-Id: I760835a10f77a6d2c6c42a00f6961e11ea4e9f2d

commit_message:
Fix: docs failure on gate

Congress docs job is failing on gate due to
non-existence of _static directory which is required
by config generator[1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/congress/blob/master/doc/source/conf.py#L120-L125

Change-Id: Ia25e677019170bfdfb3a257707a013958d518d1b

[1] https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/2.8/user_guide/playbooks_tests.html#version-comparison

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-06 14:19:27.000000000', 'message': 'support election date tagging in the governance repo

The governance repository receives special tags related to the
election that are not version numbers. It would be convenient to be
able to apply those through this repository, so this change updates
the validation rules to allow them as long as they conform to the
special pattern used by the election tools.

Change-Id: Ica091aa809243aca342dec96b58f97bce86b53b8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
support election date tagging in the governance repo

The governance repository receives special tags related to the
election that are not version numbers. It would be convenient to be
able to apply those through this repository, so this change updates
the validation rules to allow them as long as they conform to the
special pattern used by the election tools.

Change-Id: Ica091aa809243aca342dec96b58f97bce86b53b8
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Build pdf doc

The is one of community goals that each project could produce a
single PDF file. The pdf should be in the output of openstack-tox-docs
job.

TeX packages are required to build PDF locally, following is recommended:

* inkscape
* texlive-latex-base
* texlive-latex-extra
* texlive-fonts-recommended

More about the goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/pdf-doc-generation.html
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/train-pdf-support-goal
https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/pdf-goal-train-common-problems

Change-Id: Ic962cbe94cc86f4aba7f9f52182352ef95dd7002

As I know, this is the the story of creating a VM(with dpdk enabled):
1. the user sends request to nova
2. nova calls neutron to create a port
3. neutron calls ovs to create a vhostuser port

So if we would like to specify some parameters for vhostuser port, we need to see if neutron supports these parameters. We can't pre-provision the vhostuser ports, as we don't know how many VMs we are going to create in the future."}, {'account_id': 30329, 'date': '2019-05-21 16:35:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

Ok I understood . Extending the Neutron with configuration parameters and scripts for
deploying OVS with DPDK support enabled. The new functionality takes
care of binding NICs to DPDK and adding those to OVS bridges of type
'netdev'.

commit_message:
Extending Neutron chart with support for OVS DPDK

Extending the Neutron with configuration parameters and scripts for
deploying OVS with DPDK support enabled. The new functionality takes
care of binding NICs to DPDK and adding those to OVS bridges of type
'netdev'.

Co-Authored-By: Rihab Banday <rihab.banday@ericsson.com>

Change-Id: I9932123986a0b723d7523136940d325bcfde983d

commit_message:
Change PDF file name

The previously choosen PDF file name conflicts in some repos with the
project logos (badge). Thus change https://review.opendev.org/679777
renames the desired PDF name to be doc-PROJECT.pdf to allow using the
badge in PDF files.

Follow this rename.

Change-Id: I02f03a091c63abf100f8528a1d631b4565d4cc2d

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-09-06 13:49:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-09-06 13:51:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Doesn't look like this has been used to add election tags before. Hopefully the tag format doesn't cause issues."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-09-06 14:19:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-09-09 08:51:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm not sure we should use the "releases" repository to push that tag.
It's not a release... just a tag'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2019-09-09 14:37:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

The up-side to supporting it in release automation is that the election officials can be the ones to propose the tag.

Alternatively, we could just switch to using version numbers as pointers to the state of data in the repo at the time the electoral rolls were generated (we already use version numbers for the script/tooling changes in governance), and this would require no changes to release automation.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-09-10 14:22:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-09-10 14:22:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-09-10 14:36:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-09-10 16:43:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Use trash_output in create_admin_via_ssh workflow

When deploying a large amount of nodes, the create_admin_via_ssh
workflow could fail due to the large amount of ansible output generated.

This patch updates the tripleo.ansible-playbook action in the workflow
with trash_output:true so that the output is not saved in the mistral
DB.

There is a log file saved already in case the output is needed for debug
purposes.

Change-Id: I078b22fb0a0e7116f87419b444b8b4039db73ef8
Closes-Bug: #1842102
(cherry picked from commit 76d3ccc4457a3c23d5637951b5d26824bc26247e)

commit_message:
Use trash_output in create_admin_via_ssh workflow

When deploying a large amount of nodes, the create_admin_via_ssh
workflow could fail due to the large amount of ansible output generated.

This patch updates the tripleo.ansible-playbook action in the workflow
with trash_output:true so that the output is not saved in the mistral
DB.

There is a log file saved already in case the output is needed for debug
purposes.

Change-Id: I078b22fb0a0e7116f87419b444b8b4039db73ef8
Closes-Bug: #1842102
(cherry picked from commit 76d3ccc4457a3c23d5637951b5d26824bc26247e)

commit_message:
Remove transformers from the codebase

Since data frames are now handled as objects, transformers are no longer
required. This simplifies the global codebase.

Story: 2005890
Task: 36075
Change-Id: I76d9117bd95d80e51ca95804c999f145e65c3a2d

commit_message:
Handle move of ABCs to collections.abc

Resolves the following warning:

  DeprecationWarning: Using or importing the ABCs from 'collections'
  instead of from 'collections.abc' is deprecated, and in 3.8 it will
  stop working

Change-Id: Ib2214e7560cda1ef510c08859d5ee0726eb66b7b
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-09-09 14:03:53.000000000', 'message': 'Use trash_output in create_admin_via_ssh workflow

When deploying a large amount of nodes, the create_admin_via_ssh
workflow could fail due to the large amount of ansible output generated.

This patch updates the tripleo.ansible-playbook action in the workflow
with trash_output:true so that the output is not saved in the mistral
DB.

There is a log file saved already in case the output is needed for debug
purposes.

Change-Id: I078b22fb0a0e7116f87419b444b8b4039db73ef8
Closes-Bug: #1842102
(cherry picked from commit 76d3ccc4457a3c23d5637951b5d26824bc26247e)
'}]
commit_message:
Use trash_output in create_admin_via_ssh workflow

When deploying a large amount of nodes, the create_admin_via_ssh
workflow could fail due to the large amount of ansible output generated.

This patch updates the tripleo.ansible-playbook action in the workflow
with trash_output:true so that the output is not saved in the mistral
DB.

There is a log file saved already in case the output is needed for debug
purposes.

Change-Id: I078b22fb0a0e7116f87419b444b8b4039db73ef8
Closes-Bug: #1842102
(cherry picked from commit 76d3ccc4457a3c23d5637951b5d26824bc26247e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-05 12:04:19.000000000', 'message': 'Correct SELinux type for host openvswitch logs

Openvswitch server is running on the host, and puts its logs in
/var/log/openvswitch, while its agents are in containers and put logs in
/var/log/containers/openvswitch.

This means the /var/log/openvswitch container doesn't need to get the
fancy "container_file_t" type, and can be set to the right one,
openvswitch_log_t.

This will prevent issues with different softwares, such as logrotate or
even openvswitch itself on a SELinux enforcing system.

Change-Id: I4a786ecb60190759754d17f7b4e84d93f7ffb389
'}]
commit_message:
Correct SELinux type for host openvswitch logs

Openvswitch server is running on the host, and puts its logs in
/var/log/openvswitch, while its agents are in containers and put logs in
/var/log/containers/openvswitch.

This means the /var/log/openvswitch container doesn't need to get the
fancy "container_file_t" type, and can be set to the right one,
openvswitch_log_t.

This will prevent issues with different softwares, such as logrotate or
even openvswitch itself on a SELinux enforcing system.

Change-Id: I4a786ecb60190759754d17f7b4e84d93f7ffb389

commit_message:
Add "connectivity" parameter in vif_details

Added "connectivity" parameter to mech driver "vif_details" description.
The OVN mech driver has "l2" connectivity. That means this is a layer 2
networking back-end.

It supports, for example, ports with MAC address but without an IP
address assigned.

Change-Id: I1b9908b20819abb3ff155bd588b51c9909fabeeb
Related-Bug: #1821058

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-30 12:24:20.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor the L3 agent batch notifier

This patch is the first one of a series of patches improving how the L3
agents update the router HA state to the Neutron server.

This patch partially reverts the previous patch [1]. When the batch
notifier sends events, it calls the callback method passed during the
initialization, in this case AgentMixin.notify_server. The batch
notifier spawns a new thread in charge of sending the notifications and
then wait the specified "batch_interval" time. If the callback method is
not synchronous with the notify thread execution (what [1] implemented),
the thread can finish while the RPC client is still sending the
HA router states. If another HA state update is received, then both
updates can be executed at the same time. It is possible then that a new
router state can be overwritten with an old one still not sent or
processed.

The batch notifier is refactored, to improve what initally was
implemented [2] and then updated [3]. Currently, each new event thread
can update the "pending_events" list. Then, a new thread is spawned to
process this event list. This thread decouples the current execution
from the calling thread, making the event processing a non-blocking
process.

But with the current implementation, each new process will spawn a new
thread, synchronized with the previous and new ones (using a
synchronized decorator). That means, during the batch interval time, the
system can have as many threads waiting as new events received. Those
threads will end secuentially when the previous threads end the batch
interval sleep time.

Instead of this, this patch receives and enqueue each new event and
allows only one thread to be alive while processing the event list. If
at the end of the processing loop new events are stored, the thread will
process then.

[1] I3f555a0c78fbc02d8214f12b62c37d140bc71da1
[2] I2f8cf261f48bdb632ac0bd643a337290b5297fce
[3] I82f403441564955345f47877151e0c457712dd2f

Partial-Bug: #1837635

Change-Id: I20cfa1cf5281198079f5e0dbf195755abc919581
(cherry picked from commit 8b7d2c8a93fdf69a828f14bd527d8f132b27bc6e)
