commit_message:
Refactor the L3 agent batch notifier

This patch is the first one of a series of patches improving how the L3
agents update the router HA state to the Neutron server.

This patch partially reverts the previous patch [1]. When the batch
notifier sends events, it calls the callback method passed during the
initialization, in this case AgentMixin.notify_server. The batch
notifier spawns a new thread in charge of sending the notifications and
then wait the specified "batch_interval" time. If the callback method is
not synchronous with the notify thread execution (what [1] implemented),
the thread can finish while the RPC client is still sending the
HA router states. If another HA state update is received, then both
updates can be executed at the same time. It is possible then that a new
router state can be overwritten with an old one still not sent or
processed.

The batch notifier is refactored, to improve what initally was
implemented [2] and then updated [3]. Currently, each new event thread
can update the "pending_events" list. Then, a new thread is spawned to
process this event list. This thread decouples the current execution
from the calling thread, making the event processing a non-blocking
process.

But with the current implementation, each new process will spawn a new
thread, synchronized with the previous and new ones (using a
synchronized decorator). That means, during the batch interval time, the
system can have as many threads waiting as new events received. Those
threads will end secuentially when the previous threads end the batch
interval sleep time.

Instead of this, this patch receives and enqueue each new event and
allows only one thread to be alive while processing the event list. If
at the end of the processing loop new events are stored, the thread will
process then.

[1] I3f555a0c78fbc02d8214f12b62c37d140bc71da1
[2] I2f8cf261f48bdb632ac0bd643a337290b5297fce
[3] I82f403441564955345f47877151e0c457712dd2f

Partial-Bug: #1837635

Change-Id: I20cfa1cf5281198079f5e0dbf195755abc919581
(cherry picked from commit 8b7d2c8a93fdf69a828f14bd527d8f132b27bc6e)

[{'created': '2019-09-09 05:30:39.000000000', 'message': "Document block_device_mapping_v2 delete_on_termination defaults

The default values for the 'delete_on_termination' flag for
the 'block_device_mapping_v2' depends on other parameters
of the mapping and it is not obvious for a user which default
is used in which case.

commit_message:
Document block_device_mapping_v2 delete_on_termination defaults

The default values for the 'delete_on_termination' flag for
the 'block_device_mapping_v2' depends on other parameters
of the mapping and it is not obvious for a user which default
is used in which case.
This patch documents the defaults for the different cases.

Change-Id: I44e3646e55c067aea95044f5da7c5536387d6f23
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <Andreas.Florath@telekom.de>

commit_message:
Mitigate OSSN-0075

Modified the current ``glance-manage db purge`` command to eliminate images
table from purging the records. Added new command
``glance-manage db purge_images_table`` to purge the records from images
table.

DocImpact
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ie6641659b54543ed9f96c393d664e52a26bfaf6a
Implements: blueprint mitigate-ossn-0075
(cherry picked from commit 5cc9d999352c21d3f4b5c39d3ea9d4378ca86544)

commit_message:
Use connect_retries when creating clients

When creating session clients we should use 'connect_retries'
for clients that use Adapter interface. This will
allow retries when we get ConnectTimeout errors.

Task: 36331
Change-Id: Ic526c8039c91353e772eee7b55f1d263470c86bb
(cherry picked from commit 364716725a4767f8d9e3e5e1c76ecf4f969a6613
 and c7cc740f307ce8ffdf36c29094c9cbce5a6c8d14)

Add retry for sync_point_update_input_data

update_input_data in sync_point.sync() at times fails with
DBDeadlock. Let's add retry like sync_point_create()

Task: 36299
(cherry picked from commit ba9c42b9eb33b98ef68bea8d47852cfe54977b4d)

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678214/ is the project-config side of this change'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-23 12:46:40.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from update-voting-rules to formal-vote'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-08-23 12:46:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2019-08-24 02:08:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

make sense to me.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-08-25 15:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-08-26 10:25:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-08-29 10:58:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The TC members currently do not have W+1. Only the tech-committee-chair group (Chair + Vice-chair + any emeritus chair that the current chair keeps around):

https://review.opendev.org/#/admin/groups/206,members

I think it's generally good that W+1 is restricted to people who learn the house rules by heart... even if it bites us in this case.

How about we change this to "any member of the tech-committee-chair group" ?'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-08-30 10:50:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> The TC members currently do not have W+1. Only the
 > tech-committee-chair group (Chair + Vice-chair + any emeritus chair
 > that the current chair keeps around):
 > 
 > https://review.opendev.org/#/admin/groups/206,members
 > 
 > I think it's generally good that W+1 is restricted to people who
 > learn the house rules by heart... even if it bites us in this case.
 > 
 > How about we change this to "any member of the tech-committee-chair
 > group" ?

I thought everyone could have +w and we just trust people to not blindly +w?'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-08-30 11:25:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2019-08-30 11:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Thierry - yeap, if this patch merges, then https://review.opendev.org/#/c/678214/ would merge to fix the ACLs.

I think if we keep this to fast track issues, it is fine, and we can revert them if someone is over eager with a +W'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-08-30 12:05:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

(1 comment)

Ah OK.

It's just not very clear from the commit message that we would actually change to give all TC members the +W in order to handle the corner case of typo patches that would somehow actually get overlooked by the 4 people that can already +W.

I would be fine with that, but I feel like it should explicitly be called out, at least in the commit message. Also if we do that, I would not limit it to typo fixes, but also include 'code changes' (see inline)."}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2019-08-30 15:23:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2019-08-30 16:00:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-09-02 09:14:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-09-02 10:57:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1

I think it's a great idea. We trust individuals to be elected to this committee, we should trust them not to merge major decisions without further thought.

I still update the topics to relevant house-rules when applicable to help the process further."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-09-02 14:44:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2019-09-03 09:21:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-09-04 15:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2019-09-06 15:02:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

I trust everyone on the TC except myself - I kinda like not having another button I can fat-finger ;)

Abstaining because I'm happy either way. Text looks fine so CR+1."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-09-10 14:57:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote-1 Workflow+1

I'm not a fan, because then we have too many cooks in the kitchen (and we _rarely_ ever fast track patches), but it is what it is"}]

As elected representitves, we should trust in the TC members to do what is best
for the OpenStack project. For the fast tracked changes, we should not require
the chair of the TC to approve typos, or reverts, and instead trust the TC
to only use their +W where it is appropriate.

Change-Id: I010318bf872034fe6a550f1d7d1050e7e95bc76e
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

As elected representitves, we should trust in the TC members to do what is best
for the OpenStack project. For the fast tracked changes, we should not require
the chair of the TC to approve typos, or reverts, and instead trust the TC
to only use their +W where it is appropriate.

This would cause a change to the gerrit ACLs to add +W to members
of the "tech-committee" group on review.opendev.org.

Change-Id: I010318bf872034fe6a550f1d7d1050e7e95bc76e
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

commit_message:
Any member of the TC can approve fast tracked patches

As elected representitves, we should trust in the TC members to do what is best
for the OpenStack project. For the fast tracked changes, we should not require
the chair of the TC to approve typos, or reverts, and instead trust the TC
to only use their +W where it is appropriate.

This would cause a change to the gerrit ACLs to add +W to members
of the "tech-committee" group on review.opendev.org.

Change-Id: I010318bf872034fe6a550f1d7d1050e7e95bc76e
Signed-off-by: Graham Hayes <gr@ham.ie>

commit_message:
Move dynamic reconfiguration spec to untargeted

Now that we have the new untargeted folder for specs I
have a spec to make use of it.  We have approved
implementing dynamic reconfiguration (being able to change
configuration options from cinder.conf without restarting).

This is still a function that we would like to plan to get in
at some point but don't have anyone to pick up the work.  So,
I am moving it to untargeted and hope someone might pick it up.

Change-Id: I7cae8e5397659ce8ff4ab3ecb205a8228b9e7410

commit_message:
Move generic backup spec to untargeted

We have been sliding the generic backup spec along for
a while and I believe that Ivan wasn't planning to get this
in for train.  As a result I am going to move this to
untargeted and we can put it into a release when we know
the code is closer to landing.

Change-Id: Ic13e52cdb6d8dd7c83ead34fc2f80b7b03065f5e

commit_message:
[doc] Fix docs job by adding _static folder to avoid Sphinx warning

This adds _static/.keep to doc/ folder to stop the Sphinx error:

Warning, treated as error:
html_static_path entry '_static' does not exist

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/41350c344d4d45b29418a492e9b32a27

Change-Id: Iac1ee43334fe0cd68a161c1779aa308905fc6d1a

* *rally task sla_check* command was deprecated in Rally 0.8.0 in favor of

* *rally-manage db* command (and the whole *rally-manage* entry-point) was

commit_message:
Remove a bunch of deprecated stuff from CLI

* *rally task sla_check* command was deprecated in Rally 0.8.0 in favor of
  *rally task sla-check*.

* *rally-manage db* command (and the whole *rally-manage* entry-point) was
  deprecated in Rally 0.10.0 in favor of *rally db* command.

* *--namespace* argument was deprecated in Rally 0.10.0 in favor of
  *--platform* which has better meaning.
  Affected commands: *rally plugin show*, *rally plugin list*,
  *rally verify list-plugins*, *rally verify create-verifier*.

* *--tasks* argument of *rally task report* command and *--task* argument of
  *rally task use* command were deprecated in Rally 0.10.0 in favor of
  unified *--uuid* argument.

* *--junit* argument of *rally task report* command is deprecated in
  Rally 0.10.0 in favor of *rally task export --type junit-xml*

Also, this patch:

* covers @deprecated_args cli decorator with unit teststo pass cover job.

* switches functional tests to use testtools library instead of unittest
 (for unificaiton with our unit tests)

Change-Id: Icf5651117b20a8ecfe6a3e5f42eb3a4e569e0618

commit_message:
django22: The 'login' functional-based view is gone (pt. 2)

This is the larger change. We could attempt to rewrite this whole thing
to a class-based view but that's more work that it's worth right now.
Instead, we simply do what the now-removed 'login' function-based view
was doing, as seen at [1].

A lot of never-used customizability is removed because it's not needed
and made things more complicated than it needed to be.

[1] https://github.com/django/django/blob/1.11/django/contrib/auth/views.py#L133-L139

Change-Id: Ib934d8a2c32cb32761558a68f061f415bb8737c4
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Volume resource support

This change adds basic Redfish Volumes resource support to the
dynamic Redfish emulator. The Volumes are emulated as persistant
mocks backed by the libvirt volumes from the libvirt virtualization
backend.

Change-Id: If99d438c07f8a37280b1c480dcdc40510283c6d9

commit_message:
Add Python 3 Train unit tests

This is a mechanically generated patch to ensure unit testing is in place
for all of the Tested Runtimes for Train.

See the Train python3-updates goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/train/python3-updates.html

Note that openstack-python35-jobs is retained since this charm is supported
on Xenial.

Change-Id: I0e17c47636cbc213e79d5aa19a02fcac11235f37
Story: #2005924
Task: #34228

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-26 20:42:49.000000000', 'message': "django22: The 'login' functional-based view is gone (pt. 1)

As noted in the Django 2.1 release notes [1]:

  'contrib.auth.views.login()', 'logout()', 'password_change()',
  'password_change_done()', 'password_reset()', 'password_reset_done()',
  'password_reset_confirm()', and 'password_reset_complete()' are
  removed.

It's been replaced by a class-based view (CBV). There's a larger cleanup
needed, but this tackles one aspect of the change.

With this change, all the tests for the horizon application are now
passing with Django 2.2.

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.2/releases/2.1/#features-removed-in-2-1

Change-Id: Ib476e05cfcb5f6311189646d5f3c416f189744da
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-08-27 09:06:05.000000000', 'message': "django22: The 'login' functional-based view is gone (pt. 1)

As noted in the Django 2.1 release notes [1]:

  'contrib.auth.views.login()', 'logout()', 'password_change()',
  'password_change_done()', 'password_reset()', 'password_reset_done()',
  'password_reset_confirm()', and 'password_reset_complete()' are
  removed.

It's been replaced by a class-based view (CBV). There's a larger cleanup
needed, but this tackles one aspect of the change.

With this change, all the tests for the horizon application are now
passing with Django 2.2.

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.2/releases/2.1/#features-removed-in-2-1

Change-Id: Ib476e05cfcb5f6311189646d5f3c416f189744da
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-08-27 10:19:51.000000000', 'message': "django22: The 'login' functional-based view is gone (pt. 1)

  'password_change_done()', 'password_reset()', 'password_reset_done()',
  'password_reset_confirm()', and 'password_reset_complete()' are
  removed.

It's been replaced by a class-based view (CBV). There's a larger cleanup
needed, but this tackles one aspect of the change.

With this change, all the tests for the horizon application are now
passing with Django 2.2.

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.2/releases/2.1/#features-removed-in-2-1

Change-Id: Ib476e05cfcb5f6311189646d5f3c416f189744da
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
django22: The 'login' functional-based view is gone (pt. 1)

As noted in the Django 2.1 release notes [1]:

  'contrib.auth.views.login()', 'logout()', 'password_change()',
  'password_change_done()', 'password_reset()', 'password_reset_done()',
  'password_reset_confirm()', and 'password_reset_complete()' are
  removed.

It's been replaced by a class-based view (CBV). There's a larger cleanup
needed, but this tackles one aspect of the change.

With this change, all the tests for the horizon application are now
passing with Django 2.2.

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.2/releases/2.1/#features-removed-in-2-1

Change-Id: Ib476e05cfcb5f6311189646d5f3c416f189744da
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix non-functional driver configuration on Py2

For certain "static" drivers, their configuration can be passed
via config file. If not, there is a hardcoded fall back.

Prior to this fix, neither default configuration nor the fall back
worked on Py2 because of mismatching types of the dict keys - `str`
vs `unicode`.

Change-Id: I230a12fce67fddf3f1e0d0d4df5af9a68e7290a3

commit_message:
Add quotes around ansible ipv4_gateway variable

Config value dnsmasq_router missing quotes around default
value in:

 1. playbooks/inventory/group_vars/localhost
 2. playbooks/inventory/group_vars/target

So if user just uncomment option dnsmasq_router Ansible fails because
of missing quotes. Let's add these missing quotes arround
dnsmasq_router.

Change-Id: Ia8f38b00eba340e2d2cf40671f8ac8a53efc6b4e
Story: 2006517
Task: 36518

Fixing the issue instead in puppet-ovn - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580114/1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-03 09:08:57.000000000', 'message': 'ovn: Remove ovn-bridge-mappings on nodes if NeutronBridgeMappings is not defined

When updating an OVN deployed stack, if NeutronBridgeMappings is undefined, then the
previous NeutronBridgeMappings value is not cleared from the ovsdb. This results
in ovn-controller creating bridge mappings between the integration bridge and the
provider bridge in those nodes.

To address this issue, this patch adds a new step in the docker_config section of
ovn-controller service file to clear this value.

Change-Id: Icc4c6cbccb5d3b74bcacc5ba1b3f07404c2c7337
Closes-bug: #1774847
'}]
commit_message:
ovn: Remove ovn-bridge-mappings on nodes if NeutronBridgeMappings is not defined

When updating an OVN deployed stack, if NeutronBridgeMappings is undefined, then the
previous NeutronBridgeMappings value is not cleared from the ovsdb. This results
in ovn-controller creating bridge mappings between the integration bridge and the
provider bridge in those nodes.

To address this issue, this patch adds a new step in the docker_config section of
ovn-controller service file to clear this value.

Change-Id: Icc4c6cbccb5d3b74bcacc5ba1b3f07404c2c7337
Closes-bug: #1774847

commit_message:
Indent fake libvirt host capabilities fixtures more nicely

This is a simple fixup to address feedback from:

  https://review.opendev.org/#/c/677710/2/nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/fake_libvirt_data.py@86

by indenting the fixtures in a more logical and readable fashion.  A
heavy bike-shedding session eventually rejected the idea of using
textwrap.dedent for this:

  http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-nova/%23openstack-nova.2019-08-30.log.html#t2019-08-30T13:29:08

blueprint: amd-sev-libvirt-support
Change-Id: I5e9972bae53cd1f7b0ce6939f9a9f2a3bb23cd15

commit_message:
P8: Changes for programming.

Introduce v2 programming API in agent and driver, which takes
a control path ID (PCI PF's bdf), Glance UUID of the bitstream and
driver name.

The reprogramming in Intel FPGA driver still uses sudo. We will
switch to oslo.privsep after https://review.opendev.org/#/c/673957.

Change-Id: I1286c0891107926c14ce22c15d12fe42b2640d1c

Add Redfish metrics support

Added a parsing module to process Redfish-originated metrics
and submit them to Prometheus.

commit_message:
Add metrics descriptions

Added inventories of known metrics on per-source basis to supply
along with the metric name and value to Prometheus.

Change-Id: I6ea466a332b220902071bb24e2eb1fd9c23f5aaf

commit_message:
P7: Changes for ARQs and ExtARQs.

Changes to create, get, bind, unbind and delete Accelerator Requests
(ARQs) along with their associated Extended Accelerator Requests
(extARQs). Each ExtARQ has 1:1 relationship with an ARQ and shares its
uuid.

Binding may involve device preparation. For FPGAs, this includes
programming. Accordingly, this change includes Glance interaction
to query and fetch bitstreams.

After all ARQs for a device profile have either bound successfully
or failed to bind, Nova must be notified. That is addressed elsewhere
in https://review.opendev.org/674520.

Change-Id: I03710f78c876ebe587d6619deff175374f5ac4ba

commit_message:
P5: Basic changes for API layer.

Introduce changes to enable v2 APIs, needed for Nova integ.

. Create v2/ dir under cyborg/api/controllers/.
. Refactor common files and code in cyborg/api/controllers
  to share between v1 and v2.
. Enable service version discovery and microversions
  by following [1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-guide/compute/microversions.html

Change-Id: Ic73cd84cc1199ec150795a1a389eae73eda3555e

commit_message:
P6: Changes for device profiles.

Changes to create, get and delete device profiles.

In general, Cyborg v2 REST APIs operate on resource collections, with
individual resources as a subset. This should enable efficient batch
operations and scaling. Device profile APIs follow that paradigm.

Device profile names are expected to be unique. Still uuid is the
primary key, to enable renaming in the future. Accordingly you can:
. GET /v2/device_profiles/{uuid}
  GET /v2/device_profiles?names=foo,bar

. POST /v2/device_profiles with the body described in post() in
  api/controllers/v2/device_profiles.py

. DELETE /v2/device_profiles/{uuid}
  DELETE /v2/device_profiles?value=foo,bar

Change-Id: Ief1dc8f1cc959655360043b3c77db86ae3f8e66d
